1adcc3bfe5f49d7b,2020-08-01 23:29:00 UTC,"Lone Tree, CO 80124",Finance,Aurora,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Property Manager,"
Overview:

Join a team with over 50 years of success in the real estate industry! Lincoln Property Company is currently hiring for a dynamic Property Manager to oversee the financial and operational performance of a multifamily property. The Business Manager will also responsible for the supervision and motivation of the onsite property team. We are looking for an entrepreneurial minded person who enjoys leading and managing the success of a business. Does this sound like you? Join us!

Founded in 1965, Lincoln Property Company is one of the largest and most diversified property management companies in the United States. Lincoln maintains a presence in more than 200 cities across the U.S. Our mission is to be a company for people, a company about people.
Responsibilities:<div>
The responsibilities of a Property Manager are as follows:
Manage the financial performance of the property by overseeing rents, occupancies and expenditures.
Supervise resident retention, renewal and leasing programs to maintain maximum occupancy.
Oversee resident relations, which includes taking resident phone calls, requests and concerns.
Ensure compliance with Lincoln Property Company policy, as well as federal and local regulations.
Manage, train and counsel onsite staff effectively.
Oversee daily leasing paperwork and proper completion of service requests.
Analyze monthly performance and budget projections, discuss strategies with the Regional Property Manager and complete annual asset business plans and budget forecasts.
Additional duties as assigned.
Qualifications:<div>
The qualifications for a Property Manager are as follows:
A minimum of 1 year experience in onsite property management, including leasing and bookkeeping knowledge.
High school diploma or equivalent is required. Bachelor’s degree is preferred.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to motivate and lead a team.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel).
Exposure to property management software and accounting software. Experience with Yardi is a plus.
Ability to review, understand and report financial information.
A comprehensive understanding of marketing techniques and budgeting.
Able to multitask and meet deadlines in a timely and organized manner.
Must be able to work a flexible schedule, including weekends.
Must be able to tour the community with clients, which includes walking the property and climbing stairs.
Property Manager Benefits
<div>
Lincoln Property Company offers competitive pay, a benefits package that includes health, dental, vision and 401(k) and opportunities for career development and advancement",Lincoln Property Company

column1: About Us

Caliber Collision didn’t get to be the nation’s largest collision repair company by accident. It’s taken an unyielding commitment to being the collision repair center of choice in every community we serve – a vision that began when our company was founded in 1997 and continues strong to this day. To achieve this, we’re not just part of the collision repair industry - we lead it. Not only by setting new standards in customer service, but also by implementing cutting edge technology at every turn. This is how we’ve built a company with more than 1,000 convenient, state-of-the-art repair centers and growing, and why hundreds of thousands of people entrust their vehicles to us every year. We are driven by our purpose – to restore you to the Rhythm of your Life. A career at Caliber is not for everyone, but if you’ve got the drive, we’ve got your ride!
Posted Date: Jul 28, 2020
Requisition Number: R0084587
Position Type: Full-time",Caliber Collision

fb001b3edb13279b,2020-08-01 15:13:00 UTC,"Denver, CO",product+manager,Aurora,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Sr Product Manager,"
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager who has a proven track record of leading teams to deliver consumer products in mobile platforms. You will partner with product managers, architects, engineers, and researchers to help us enable new scale and market offerings in the video streaming space.

Our ideal team member is a strategic thinker, who loves video streaming and tricky technical challenges, and gets the job done. Our future team member should also be able to slow down, applying business sense and strategy to ensure investments have meaningful business impact. This person must be highly adaptable and collaborative in a fast-paced environment. This is a role with breadth and depth, with plenty of partnership opportunities across different disciplines as well as clear areas of direct ownership. Mobile and video streaming product management experience is a must.
Responsibilities
• Deliver product vision and roadmap
Develop and communicate product concepts
Lead a highly functional technical/operations team including engineering, QA, and product design to consistently deliver product releases

Manage the end to end process of new product launches including various phases of a product lifecycle such as pre-launch (product planning), launch (product execution) and post-launch (product measuring).
Work with the enterprise team(s) on any related Go-To-Market launch deliverables
Work with business and technology partners to lead, manage and prioritize product backlog
Lead product backlog grooming sessions
Collect functional, customer and technical requirements of a product
Define customer journeys, user flows and deliver various product artifacts including PRD, user stories, product specifications and related acceptance criteria.
Work with team to analyze and report product data to make informed decisions
Conduct A/B product testing and continuously improve product performance
Ensure that high standards of reliability, quality, usability and measurement are adhered to throughout each phase of product development.
Qualifications
• 5+ years of applied Product Management experience
Minimum of 10+ years of professional experience
Prior Product experience with a focus on video streaming, content distributions workflows and application development

Experience working with portfolio management systems and bug tracking systems, such as Google Firebase, Google Analytics, Periscope, Apptentive customer feedback solution, JIRA bug system and Confluence management
Experiences in Agile methodology including product grooming, sprint planning and retro deliverables
Preferred:
MBA preferred
Company Profile

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: ""TMUS"") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com
Applicant Privacy Policy

We are committed to maintaining your trust by respecting and protecting your privacy. For more information about how T-Mobile processes the personal data of job applicants, please visit Applicant Privacy Policy.
EOE Statement

We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice. T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. 32eded1c0f37437d,2020-08-01 07:28:00 UTC,"Broomfield, CO",Support+Engineer,Aurora,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Senior Software Engineer,"
Company Description

Conga’s suite of solutions creates more efficient organizations by simplifying and automating data, documents, contracts and reporting. As the provider of the #1 paid application on the Salesforce AppExchange, we have more than a decade of experience increasing the value of the Sales Cloud by removing systems and process pain points that impede the customer lifecycle. Our 8000+ customers are passionate about our platform and support giving us 5 stars on the Salesforce AppExchange.

Conga offers a fast-paced, dynamic environment for professionals looking to help build and enhance a seamless customer experience. Our top of the line product suite, dedicated employees, and proven leadership team provide a solid foundation to support our continued growth and success. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including 100% paid health insurance for employees, 401k plan, generous PTO schedule, and lots of additional perks!
Job Description
Position Description:

We are looking for a talented Senior Software Development Engineer to help us advance the suite of Conga products. This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to use his or her expertise in development as a member of a dynamic team that designs, develops, tests, and maintains the Conga products. We want to hire unbelievably bright developers, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. We believe in using the best tools for the task at hand so the ability and desire to learn new programming languages and technologies is a must. All of this adds up to an exciting, challenging, and always interesting place to work, where hard problems are found and solved every day.
This position will work out of our Broomfield, CO office. We are not seeking a remote employee.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop a deep understanding of the relevant business areas and various components in the stack
  • Take ownership of, architect, build and scale business critical services
  • Be introspective, always trying to improve yourself and the team around you
  • Participate on a DevOps / agile team full lifecycle and full stack, including design, development, testing, planning, backlog grooming and support
  • Design and Develop REST API’s for internal and external consumption
  • Develop and maintain related application code – full stack development
  • Develop unit tests to run in a continuous integration environment
  • Identify and implement best practices for coding as well as development processes
  • Perform as a trusted contributor requiring little to no supervision and demonstrating the ability to meet deadlines, exceed goals, and create benchmarks for success
Qualifications
Knowledge, Skills and Experience (Required):

• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline or equivalent work experience
  • Solid communication skills and ability to convey technical solutions to end-user of all abilities
  • Demonstrated professionalism interacting with a variety of audiences both internally and externally
  • Proactive, self-driven and enjoys solving complex problems, not just in the primary area of responsibility but across boundaries.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience (Preferred):

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience with JavaScript libraries such as Sencha Ext JS, React, AngularJS, or jQuery
  • Programming experience in .NET, C#, JavaScript, Java, or C++ with demonstrated drive to learn and progress in the technical skill and nuanced art of development
  • Experience with SQL databases
  • Demonstrated success executing development work within an Agile environment
  • Cloud experience preferred – AWS, Azure or similar
  • Salesforce Force.com development experience
Additional Information
Why should you work for Conga?
From day one you’ll become an integral and active part of Conga’s culture
You will work with a passionate and motivated team
You will be truly empowered to make a difference. We work with innovators, thinkers, and people who push the status quo
You will never hear “that’s not your job” but rather be encouraged to solve problems with creative ideas
You will see your effort and impact come to life as you test boundaries, break down barriers, and skyrocket your career

Conga is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, parental or pregnancy status, marriage and civil partnership, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

",Conga

8af2ffd282686700,2020-08-01 15:27:00 UTC,"Denver, CO",Support+Engineer,Aurora,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Principal Malware Reverse Engineer (Remote - USA),"
Company Description

FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 9,000 customers across 103 countries, including more than 50 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.
Job Description

Mandiant’s Front Line Applied Research and Expertise (FLARE) team works on our in-depth reverse engineering and malware analysis support to various functions of the Mandiant Solutions business. By utilizing front-line knowledge gained from incident response engagements, malware samples, and globally deployed FireEye products, FLARE is able to find evil and expand wisdom.

If you have strong programming skills, experience in malware analysis or reverse engineering, and are looking for an opportunity to collaborate with an industry-leading team, then this may be the opportunity for you. As a reverse engineer working within FLARE you will dissect attacker tools and backdoors in support of incident responders. You will also help develop innovative tools to aid other business lines and automate malware analysis and reverse engineering efforts.
This position can be based out of Reston, VA, New York, NY or Denver, CO
column2: the team will consider remote locations within the US for well-qualified candidates.

column1: What You Will Do:
Analyze executables and malicious files
Collaborate with a team of experienced malware analysts and researchers
Develop novel solutions to challenges facing incident responders and malware analysts
Support the company’s research and development efforts
Qualifications
Requirements:
Strong programming skills
Ability to analyze disassembly of x86 and x64 binaries
Knowledgeable in the use of:<ul><li>
IDA Pro disassembler
User- and kernel-mode debuggers
Common binary file formats
Dynamic analysis tools
Network analysis tools
Ability to reverse engineer binaries of various types including:<ul><li>
C/C++
Delphi
NET
Flash
Compiled VBScript
Understanding of software exploits
Experience developing scripts to decode obfuscated data and network communications
Experience developing applications in C, C++, and .NET
Thorough understanding of network protocols
Experience mitigating anti-reverse engineering techniques
Additional Qualifications:
Ability to analyze shellcode
Ability to analyze packed and obfuscated code
Capable of Python scripting to automate analysis tasks
Capable of identifying host- and network-based indicators
Additional Information

At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Requests for accommodation due to disability can be sent directly to HR-Accommodations@FireEye.com.

","FireEye, Inc."

77de1dc094efe2a0,2020-08-01 07:34:00 UTC,"Englewood, CO 80112",Account+Management,Aurora,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Annual Giving Specialist - Full-Time,"<div class=""jobsearch-jobDescriptionText"" id=""jobDescriptionText"">Christian Living Communities, and its management division Cappella Living Solutions, provides senior living communities and services in six states. Our vision is creating communities where aging is honored and celebrated.
Position Summary

As an enthusiastic voice for organizational vision, mission and values, the Annual Giving Specialist effectively articulates the case for monetary support as it relates to the organization’s mission. The Annual Giving Specialist will have primary responsibility for ensuring a successful annual fund and related campaigns and appeals. This position oversees the donor database and donor acknowledgements, establishes and implements data-entry policies and procedures to ensure data consistency and quality, and leads efforts to develop philanthropic strategies. Routinely seeks connections and prospective opportunities for donor relations to make a difference in community and organizational life.
Essential Duties
<ul>
• Leads the creation of the annual fundraising aspects of the Donor Relations Plan including related appeals aimed to increase and maintain gifts in support of the mission.
• Responsible for creating, implementing and reporting on all the annual giving efforts.
• Direct planning and support or staffing for special event fundraisers.
• Develops a corporate giving strategy that includes identifying and soliciting corporate partners.
• Leads the creation and execution of direct mail campaigns that align with annual giving efforts.
• Creates the annual giving communication strategy, to include gathering, writing and sharing stories of donor impact.
• Partners with the Director of Donor Relations to execute on a “donor-centered” strategies, that includes a stewardship plan.
• Oversight of the donor relations data base, gift processing and training of team members to support the administrative function of the department.
• Responsible for monthly chart of accounts reporting to accounting.
• Conducts quarterly deep-dive analysis through reporting, to focus on second-time donors, repeat donors, and potential monthly donors, to discover trends and for future segmentation.
• Serve as a Donor Relations team liaison by working from a community on a regular basis to build and strengthen relationships with residents, family members and team.
• Other duties as assigned.
Basic Qualifications Experience
<ul>
• Bachelor Degree in Communications, Marketing or related field, required.
• 4 years of experience in fund raising
• Excellent interpersonal, written and presentation skills
• Must have special event experience, event planning and coordination.
• Demonstrates ability to organize and execute large scale gift giving events
• Must have fundraising database experience.
• Must possess excellent customer service skills
• Must be goal oriented and driven to succeed while at the same time fostering strong inter-personal relationships with a wide variety of people
• Must be able to read, write and speak English
Working Conditions / Physical Requirements
<ul>
• Sits, stands, bends and moves intermittently during working hours.
• Lifting, pushing or pulling up to 25 pounds intermittently.
• Must possess a Colorado driver’s license in good standing. Job may require occasional travel in and outside the state.
• Is subject to frequent interruptions.
• Frequently interacts with relevant stakeholders including team members, donors, vendor partners, residents and family members.
",Christian Living Communities

ebdc03f6a7a8fc19,2020-08-01 15:24:00 UTC,"Denver, CO 80202 (Union Station area)",software+developer,Aurora,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Senior QA Automation Engineer,"

At PointsBet, we have only built a fraction of what we have imagined. Data and Engineering are the life blood of our company in one the largest emerging markets – the multi-billion dollar industry of Sportsbetting. Our work is incredibly complex, touching on Software Engineering, Data Science, Governance, large-scale distributed systems, user behavior - just to name a few. At PointsBet we ship software that helps people escape from everyday stress and lets people play. PointsBet is a cutting-edge bookmaker that prides itself on having the quickest and most user-friendly app (iOS and Android) using React and React Native calling cloud hosted microservices
column2:
we are obsessed with constant innovation to offer the best user experience.

We are seeking a Senior QA Engineer to join our newest office location in Denver, CO (only 3 blocks from Union Station). In this role you will be responsible for the testing and ensuring the quality of web site and mobile apps and ensuring that solutions developed address a variety of concerns including performance, scalability, availability and security. Ability to understand and transform complex business requirements into actionable automation tests is essential. An ideal candidate will be a highly organized, self-starter with a passion for Automation, DevOps culture and modern CI/CD and Infrastructure deployment practices.

Required Skills:

  • B.S./M.S. in computer science or software engineering preferred
  • 6+ years professional experience in a manual tester role
  • Strong analytical skills (debugging, tinkering)
  • Exposure to API Testing tools such as Postman will be highly regarded
  • Automation testing experience of API’s Web and mobile apps (Selenium, Cucumber etc.)
  • Experience with Defect Management Tools (preference is TFS / Jira / VSTS )
  • Knowing how to write tests for architecture and distributed systems
  • Test planning, system testing (system requirement verification), exploratory testing and performance testing
  • Experience with SQL is a plus
  • 2+ years of Object-Oriented Programming (JavaScript, Java etc.)
  • Tenacity in identifying underlying root causes testing native iOS or Android applications

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Operating in an Agile software delivery methodology
  • Experience with regression testing of Web and Mobile Apps
  • Excellent understanding of QA Concepts like black box testing, white box testing, unit testing
  • Great team attitude and up for fast paced working environment
  • Identify and present the technical trade-offs and risks of different testing approaches in a meaningful way
  • Contribute a comprehensive understanding of current and emerging technologies and testing tools
  • Be passionate about software quality, and testing
  • Ensure projects are consistently delivered on time.
  • Keen to learn Automation

BENEFITS: Medical, Dental + Vision insurance, FSA, 401k (with a very generous match), commuter benefits, gym discount and PTO. PointsBet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Location: Downtown Denver – 3 blocks from Union Station

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work authorization:

  • United States (Required)

Company's website:

  • www.pointsbet.com

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

Job Description:

Front-End Developer – React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS

i4 Insight is seeking a (Senior/Mid-Level) Front-End developer experienced with React/Redux to join our software engineering team. You will use a wide variety of technologies, such as React, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Azure, SQL, JSON, Npm, NuGet, Linux, PowerBI, Docker, NoSQL and other technologies to solve real world problems. We are believers in using the right tool for the job, thus giving you the opportunity to explore emerging technologies.

We are looking for a dynamic individual who can build and design performant and effective front-end web applications that support complex business rules/flows. The engineering team is committed to agile value delivery and solid engineering principles, as well as continuously improving our craft.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for delivering software as a service, enjoy working in a fast-paced team environment and will go the extra mile to get the job done right.

This position is based in the Denver Tech Center and provides opportunities to work with breakthrough technology, exciting customers, and fantastic colleagues from around the world.

About i4 Insight

I4 is helping some of the largest companies in the world digitally transform their businesses. I4 Insight is focused on creating a Cloud Platform based Digital Ecosystem that collects data from disparate sources and can connect your niche applications into an integrated solution that provides Intelligent Insight into our customers business -- providing sustainable benefit to all parties. We believe when the data and application silos come down new interrelationships will be uncovered, and new savings and advantages will be delivered.

The initial focus will be in the commercial maritime shipping market with plans to expand into other markets in the future.

While our vision is quite large, we can’t do this alone. Our passion, professionalism and vision are backed by a giant in the Maritime industry – Lloyd’s Register.

LR’s Digital &
column2:
Software division is deeply committed to this digital evolution. They cut through the data noise to enhance asset performance, take an intelligent approach to risk management and ultimately give confidence that steers strategic operations. We have come together to accelerate this evolution through a shared vision, the deep resources that Lloyd’s Register can provide, and the entrepreneurial speed and tenacity that our customers deserve. i4 is a proud member of the Lloyd’s Register Group.

This gives us the ability to operate like an entrepreneurial company while having the benefits and backing of a large market leading organization.

What you will do

  • You’ll be working in a highly productive, collaborative and innovative environment where your voice is heard
  • Work with the latest technology and approaches
  • Participate in the Design, implementation and delivery of complex products
  • Work with Product Management to understand and solve customer issues

Who you are

We need developers who share our passion for building cutting edge web applications. We are looking for candidates who have

  • 5+ years of experience with web applications in JavaScript
  • 2+ years of experience with React
  • Expert JavaScript developer using ES2015/ES6 or newer
  • Experience working in an agile environment
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proficient with MVC, HTML, CSS
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering degree
  • Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms and variety of design paradigms including OO design
  • Excellent analytical and troubleshooting abilities
  • Ability to work independently

Major Pluses but not Mandatories

  • 1+ years with Redux
  • 2+ years of experience with C#
  • Comfortable Configuring Webpack and Babel
  • Node.js, JSON, Npm, JQuery, Ajax, Bootstrap
  • Experience with CI/CD

What is in it for you

  • Competitive Salary
  • 3 weeks’ vacation + 11 days company holidays + 12 Sick Days
  • Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance/Disability benefits package
  • Fun and challenging environment

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S, we are sorry we cannot sponsor visas at this time.

I4 Insight is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color. Religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, stats as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor.

Job Title:Front of House Hourly
Reports To: Management, COO
Prepared Date:July 6th, 2020
Classification:Non-Exempt
Compensation: $12- $18/ hour
Position Summary:

Birdcall is a rapidly growing, technology-enabled, hip fast casual restaurant. Birdcall offers an all-natural, healthy dining experience that focuses on contactless ordering. Birdcalls goal is to make unbelievable food more accessible and affordable while giving back to the local communities that support us through the 1% program. These core values on guests, their dining experience and giving back extends throughout Birdcall's culture.

We are searching for highly motivated Front of House professionals looking to partner with a top-notch team and make a major impact on a Company experiencing explosive growth in Colorado and beyond. The ideal candidate has experience hosting, greeting, welcoming guests and members of the community while assisting customers with their needs and providing excellent hospitality service. He or she will be the face of Birdcall and be responsible for maintaining the standards of the Company!
General Duties and Responsibilities:
The Front of House employees are responsible for providing hospitality standards including guest service and safety. Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Welcoming the guests, presenting the kiosk concept, and presenting menus to guests

column1: Job Overview
Cleans and prepares guest rooms by meeting established standards of cleanliness and propriety to assure guest satisfaction and maximize revenues.
Responsibilities

Retrieves items from shelves and storerooms, sets up cleaning cart with supplies, constantly maintaining carts and storerooms in a clean and orderly fashion to enhance efficiency and ease of cleaning rooms.

Cleans and wipes windows, doors, walls, closets and fixtures in rooms, public areas and hallways, often using ladders or stools to clean hard to reach areas, in order to maintain a clean, presentable and attractive facility at all times. Washes shower walls and tub, cleans toilet(s) and stall walls if applicable, wipes exposed pipes, cleans mirrors, sink(s) and walls in order to have clean and sanitary guest and public restrooms.
Replaces towels, soaps and all room amenities and restocks literature that has been removed by previous guest or is soiled and torn to ensure adequate supply for arriving guests.
Washes all hard floor areas (linoleum, tile, etc.) by hand to remove dirt and soiled areas.
Dusts and polishes all furniture, fixtures and wall hangings including using a duster to reach vents and ceiling corners to remove dust and cobwebs.
Strips bed of all linen and remakes with fresh, checking bedspread, blankets and bed pads for cleanliness, replacing if soiled.
Lifts mattresses to check for soil between mattresses and under bed.
Checks closet for cleanliness, wiping closet door, handle and overhead shelves and restocking the guest room supplies such as hangers, extra blankets and pillows.

Vacuums rooms, public areas and hallways, operating vacuums weighing up to 25lbs., and lifting/moving heavy furniture in order to vacuum entire area of carpet including underneath furniture and hard to reach areas.
Inspects all door and window locks to ensure they are in working order and immediately alerts management to an unsecured or unsafe situation for the safety of guests and employees.

Inspects all room equipment (TV, lights/lamps, faucets, radios) to ensure proper working order and immediately reports all room status and room maintenance deficiencies, in writing, to the Executive Housekeeper for prompt repair/resolution.
Secures and maintains custody of equipment, keys and supplies at all times in order to protect and preserve hotel property.
Maintains a friendly, cheerful and courteous demeanor at all times.
Performs other duties as assigned, requested or deemed necessary by management
Qualifications
Education/Formal Training
No formal education or training
Experience
None
Knowledge/Skills
Must have basic knowledge of general cleaning principles, use of cleaning products and operation of standard cleaning equipment.
Must be able to understand and follow verbal/written instructions and communicate both verbally and in writing.
Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Must be able to lift up to 50lbs. continually throughout a shift.
Must be able to push, pull and move levers, equipment and furniture throughout a shift.
Must be able to work with arms raised above head throughout a shift.
Must be able to maneuver fully loaded maid cart, weighing up to 50lbs., through hallways and into/out of closets during entire work day.
Ability to identify minute debris and dirt in poorly lit areas, and to read written instructions and computer print-outs.
Environment
Prolonged strenuous physical activity in indoor climate-controlled environment.
Excessive heat and humidity in laundry. Inside 95% of shift.
Position Type: Regular Full-Time
Property : Marriott DTC
Outlet: Hotel
Address : 4900 S Syracuse St
City : Denver
State : Colorado
EOE Protected Veterans/Disability",Sage Hospitality Resources

The Opportunity

Underwriting Analysts play a critical role at Berkadia supporting multi-billion-dollar lending platforms. The Underwriting Analyst will help analyze proposed transactions, prepare formal recommendations, and assist in the closing and delivery of approved loans to necessary constituents. A candidate with the desire to learn and grow will have the opportunity to advance within the team and company overall.
<div><b>
Responsibilities
Support underwriters (including deputy chief underwriters and chief underwriter) execute business.

Analyze multifamily and senior housing real estate transactions, which includes assisting in the collection and review of loan due diligence materials, the generation of underwriting pro forma cash flows, identifying and evaluating risks and mitigates associated with a proposed transaction, and preparing formal presentations for loan committee.
Assist in all aspects of deal processing from application through underwriting and closing to delivery of the loan to servicing and/or investor.
Coordinate and monitor loan underwriting tasks performed by offshore resources as well as external third parties to ensure timely and accurate delivery of work product.
Perform site inspections of collateral associated with proposed loans.
Other duties as assigned.
<div><b>
What someone will need to be successful in this role
Adhere to Berkadia’s policies and exhibit proficiency and understanding of Berkadia’s Values and position-specific skills.
Excellent organizational, analytic, and quantitative skills, detail oriented and possess a high level of initiative.
Knowledge of cash flow analysis and exposure to commercial real estate preferred.
Technology Experience with MS Office, especially Excel with prior experience with Salesforce preferred.
Solid communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to travel occasionally.
Ability to interface with team members, work in a team environment and adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
<div><b>
Employee Benefits
18 PTO days + 2 floating holidays &amp
column2: 10 paid holidays per year

column1: Job Summary

A consumer centric, analytical, and detail-oriented individual with a background in warehousing, logistics, and supply chain analytics will be placed on the Ecommerce Sales and Operations team. The ideal candidate has the ability to lead and influence people, analyze data, and make sound recommendations in an often ambiguous environment. The role will scope, develop, manage, and execute supply chain strategies, focused on managing inventory efficiencies, chargeback mitigation, and project development/management across multiple customer teams. This position will integrate into an entrepreneurial team, which wears many hats and operates in a highly collaborative environment. Success will be measured by driving sustainable, long-term growth, both online and offline.

Our Commercial Operations team is a cross-business unit organization responsible for operational activities and execution to enable the success of business unit strategies for both digital and traditional channels. Our Commercial Operations organization consists of teams focused in the following areas: Consumer Insights &amp
column2: Analytics, Digital Consumer Experience, Ecommerce Sales Strategy &amp

column1: Job Summary

This position develops a rolling 24-month unit and revenue demand forecast for assigned ecommerce customers incorporating account business intelligence, endless aisle strategies, new items, new item cannibalization, promotion plans, historical and current POS and shipment trends by taking a leadership role in collaborative forecasting, analyzing data and maximizing system utilization.
Primary Duties &amp
column2: Responsibilities

column1: <ul>
• Utilizes knowledge of statistical forecasting techniques including time-series, linear regression and executes forecasting processes that includes model calibration.
<li>Develops and gain buy-in from sales team business partners an item level unit forecast, and monthly consensus revenue forecast to include:
• New product forecasts, monitoring sell through and customer inventory levels of new items for assigned forecast customers
• Promotional forecasts based on customer’s purchasing strategy and ad plans
• Facilitate monthly forecast collaboration meetings with sales team business partners. Prepare analysis to support position and recommendations in clear concise formats to facilitate agreement.
• Monitor and work to eliminate the gap between bottom up demand forecast and top down management dollar forecast.

• Demand Sensing: Monitor shipment and POS demand data to determine patterns, trends, variability to include but not limited to deviations in demand due to weather, competitive situations and customer's inventory strategies, retail price variability.
• Analyze and report forecast results (consumption, accuracy and root cause for error). Make forecast adjustments and take corrective action in forecast process to minimize error.
• Maintain customer item attributes to include listing status, promotional status, store count, customer item numbers, forecast price.
• Work system generated alerts which identify trends and forecast bias.
• Work with Finance business partners to drive accurate price data for forecast by item, by time period.
<li>Create the Annual Operating Plan Forecast for assigned Forecast Customers.
• Prepare bridge analysis as needed
• Work as stakeholder on system development projects to include design and testing with supply chain and IT business partners

<li>Bachelor’s degree required in business or related field plus 3 to 5 years of progressively responsible experience in the field of S&amp
column2: OP, Supply Planning, Forecasting.

column1: <li>Advanced Excel &amp
column2: MS Office skills required

825324e9b1684678,2020-08-01 23:28:00 UTC,"Austin, TX",Finance,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,HealthStart Foundation Executive Director,"

Our Mission: Build Healthier Communities Through Children's Health and Science Education

Since 2010, HealthStart has delivered tools to build healthier communities through children's health and science education to more than 8,000+ young Texans. In response to current events, HealthStart is transitioning much of our programming to digital learning through video and online distribution. Moving online has opened up exciting opportunities to expand our geographic reach and for increased growth.

We seek a visionary thinker with exceptional fundraising skills who can see the potential HealthStart holds for building healthier futures for children and communities nationwide.

HealthStart's primary focus is to provide children, 3-10 years of age, and their families with the tools to make smart health decisions. We currently offer a science-based preschool health curriculum, an elementary school nutrition education program, community-based workshops, a mobile game app, and an online children's video series. All programs teach kids the science behind good health.
*
HealthStart Foundation Executive Director

The Executive Director is the key management leader of the HealthStart Foundation (HSF). The Executive Director is responsible for overseeing the organization's administration, programs, and strategic plan, ensuring adherence to its mission. Other primary duties include fundraising, marketing, community outreach, and expansion of program reach. The position reports directly to the Board of Directors.

General Responsibilities

Organization Mission and Strategy: Works with the board and staff to ensure that HSF's fulfills its mission through programs, strategic planning, and community outreach.

  • Implement HSF's programs to carry out the organization's mission and expand its reach.
  • Responsible for strategic planning to ensure that HSF can successfully fulfill its mission into the future.
  • Create complete business plans to attain goals and objectives set by working alongside the board of directors. Report to the board monthly on HSF's progress toward achieving the plan's goals.
  • Serve as the face of the organization and actively participate in external events, increasing visibility, credibility, and brand in the market, and developing strategic partnerships to increase community awareness and expand the program.
  • Enhance HSF's image by being active and visible in the community and working closely with other professionals, civic, and private organizations. Establish and maintain relationships with various organizations and utilize those relationships to enhance HSF's mission strategically.

Financial Performance and Viability: Develops and manages resources ensuring the financial health of the organization.

  • Expand revenue generation and fundraising activities to support existing operations and program expansion.
  • Set and meet aggressive annual fundraising goals, in partnership with board of directors, to secure financial support from foundations, corporations, individuals, and government funding sources.
  • Submit a proposed annual budget, and monthly financial statements to the board for their review
  • Manage HFS's financial responsibilities, including operating within the approved budget, ensuring maximum resource utilization, and maintaining HSF in a positive financial position.

Organization Operations: Oversees and implements appropriate resources to ensure that the operations of the organization are appropriate.

  • Build and lead a capable team dedicated to fulfilling the organization's mission through highly successful program implementation, community engagement, and fundraising targets.
  • Ensure effective systems to track and measure success and evaluate program effectiveness regularly so that HSF can report this information to the board, funders, and other stakeholders.
  • Review and approve contracts for services, including signing all notes, agreements, and other instruments made and entered into on behalf of the organization.
  • Establish employment and administrative policies and procedures for all functions and the day-to-day operation of the organization.
  • Oversee external communication materials including, website, marketing materials, newsletters and social media content
  • Work with staff and board on annual benefits and additional fundraising events.
  • Manage and coordinate volunteer and professional relationships in support of HSF events, major/planned gift fundraising activities, and their annual campaign.

Board Governance: Works with board in order to fulfill the organization’s mission.

  • Lead HSF in a manner that supports and guides the organization's mission as defined by the Board of Directors.
  • Communicate effectively with the board by providing all necessary information in a timely and accurate manner, so the board functions well and can make informed decisions.
  • Oversee organization's board and committee meetings
  • Report to and work closely with the Board of Directors to seek their involvement in policy decisions, fundraising, and to increase the organization's overall visibility.
  • Develop, maintain, and support a strong Board of Directors
column2: serve as ex-officio of each committee
column3:
seek and build board involvement with strategic direction for ongoing local operations and the national rollout.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree and a minimum of three years of leadership within a nonprofit organization experience
  • High-level strategic thinking and planning. Ability to envision and convey the organization's strategic future to the staff, board, volunteers, and donors.
  • Excellence in organizational management, including the ability to coach, manage and develop high-performance teams, set and achieve strategic objectives, and handle a budget.
  • Ability to effectively communicate the organization's mission to donors, volunteers and the overall community
  • Possess solid knowledge of accounting, budgeting, financial management, and marketing.
  • Fluency in Microsoft Office suite or equivalent.
  • Successful resource development, fundraising, and philanthropy experience. A history of successfully growing and generating new revenue streams and improving financial results.
  • Active fundraising experience. Excellent donor relations skills and understanding of the funding community. Previous success in establishing relationships with individuals and organizations of influence, including funders, partner agencies, and volunteers.
  • Strong ability to plan, delegate, develop programs, and facilitate task completion.
  • Demonstrates a strong work ethic with a high degree of energy.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in developing and implementing public-private partnerships to achieve community-wide social and economic goals.
  • Experience in primary education, school food services, or nutrition is a plus.
  • Comfort with the execution of social media marketing and media campaigns preferred.

Salary/Benefits

  • Initially, part-time with the expectation that the ED will become full-time within six months.
  • Salary will be $30k-35k depending on experience plus a stipend for healthcare coverage. Pay will increase, accordingly, when the position transitions to full-time.
  • HealthStart headquarters are in Austin, Texas. Due to COVID-19, the ED should expect to work remotely.

Instructions for applying

Please submit cover letter, resume and two references

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $30,000.00 - $35,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible Schedule
  • Health Insurance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Nonprofit Leadership: 3 years (Required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Required)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Company's website:

  • https://www.healthstartfoundation.org/

Company's Facebook page:

  • www.facebook.com/healthstart

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

COMPANY BACKGROUND

Black Dragon Capital LLC (BDC) is a unique growth-oriented private equity firm focused on investing in areas where information technology is enabling the disruption of industries by allowing a faster, better and more economically compelling way to solve industry issues. We seek to benefit from a diverse perspective combined with high performance operating and investment executives. We hire and promote based on merit, without bias, and make a genuine effort to ensure we have a diversified team that aligns with the diversity of our portfolio companies and their clients. We intend to maintain over 65% of our team members as culturally or gender diverse, and work hard to foster a supportive and welcoming workplace. Bringing a leadership and advisory group of successful entrepreneurs, former operators and deal making experience, Black Dragon’s team has a track record of building market leading companies, driving above market returns and accelerating growth and profitability through its distribution connections, strategic advice, and active participation within our investments, primarily in financial technologies, eCommerce, and sports and media technology markets.
THE ROLE

BDC is looking for a proven business leader to join our expanding team in South Florida. The right BDC leaders have an established track record of building a company’s value as a CFO and/or as an executive-level operating partner in the technology industry with a readiness to crossover to a Partner-level role in a private equity fund. As a professional with an operational background, you will be valued in a way that few P/E firms would appreciate. You will join a team of successful operating executives and entrepreneurs with extensive M&amp
column2: A experience, and who have created billions in value. Do you have a strong senior financial executive background with extensive deal making experience? This is a rare opportunity for you because unlike most funds, we place more value in operational experience than the school you attended. Working in concert with our team, you will oversee all aspects of the investment cycle with particular emphasis on transactional deal activities and assessment of new investments. You will have control of the entire investment process from sourcing to distribution. Along the acquisition journey, you’ll gain access to our advisors, distribution connections, proprietary operational tools, and to our value creation team with whom you’ll collaborate on post transaction, value-enhancing activities.

column1: ABOUT YOU

You have been a CFO, COO, or CEO at a growing tech company, so you know the loneliness, excitement, and joy that comes from pioneering an industry and building a lasting company. You’ve had to make extremely tough judgment calls and overcome seemingly insurmountable obstacles, often in high pressure situations. You’ve dealt with pitfalls, but you never stop believing and always find a way to win. You have a bias toward hands on management, a sense of urgency, demonstrate strong leadership and communication skills, and the ability to motivate teams while managing multiple projects. Not only have you succeeded but you’ve had big wins! And you continually use those learnings to guide strategic input and leadership on decision making which could have included evaluating potential alliances, and strategic add-on acquisitions. You are detail-oriented and demonstrate the ability to quickly understand the primary drivers of a variety of businesses, and you can quickly analyze and interpret complex financial data. Lastly, you know the uniqueness of working at a growing Private Equity company as a lead investment executive.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the pre-acquisition due diligence team and provide detailed and insightful analysis of the primary risks and opportunities of a target company.
Establish and nurture relationships with entrepreneurs to earn their confidence in order to facilitate deals.
Provide guidance to entrepreneurs to achieve growth while maintaining profitability in difficult operating environments.
Develop and implement strategic goals to organizations and provide direction and leadership while executing complex capital and operational restructuring.
Cash management, including capital requirements, investment funding, manage reserves, etc.
Oversee complex loan agreements and other financing instruments.
successfully raise capital in both public and private markets within technology segments. i.e. private raises, debt financing (bonds) and equity raises.
Establish credibility throughout the organization and with the Board as an effective developer of solutions to business challenges.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree required, MBA and CPA preferred.
Willingness to work a flexible schedule that may include frequent travel.
Minimum of ten years of demonstrated experience in providing banking, accounting, auditing or financial planning.
Experience with operations, heavy mergers and acquisitions, and capital raising activities for various forms of equity and debt instruments.

Successful track record of working with and building relationships with the finance community including investment bankers, venture and private equity professionals, venture capital partners and other financial professionals.
LOCATION
Boca Raton, FL area with telework. Relocation assistance is available for your move.
About Black Dragon Capital:

Black Dragon Capital (“BDC”) is a minority-controlled, growth driven private equity fund created by technology operating executives with a track record of creating market leading companies and an impressive investment return history. We seek to benefit from a diverse perspective combined with high performance operating and investment executives. We hire and promote based on merit, without bias, and make a genuine effort to ensure we have a diversified team that aligns with the diversity of our portfolio companies and their clients. We intend to maintain over 65% of our team members as culturally or gender diverse, and work hard to foster a supportive and welcoming workplace. BDC focuses on the areas where it has direct operating and investment expertise that include technology investment opportunities in industries disrupted by the impact of digitization on individuals, groups and enterprises such as retail commerce, financial services, healthcare, and sports and media. The operationally focused fund has driven above market returns by creating unique sourcing, funding, recruiting, growth and return opportunities.

AllianceBernstein Private Credit Investors Overview
AllianceBernstein Private Credit Investors (“AB-PCI”) was founded in April 2014 with a mandate to grow into a multi-billion dollar private corporate credit investing platform.

AB-PCI invests in middle-market companies across various industry sectors. Companies typically have robust business models, strong competitive positions, sustainable enterprise value and predictable cash flow profiles. The group maintains a strong credit culture and pursues a highly selective investment process based on fundamental due diligence and a focus on transaction terms and documentation.

AB-PCI pursues a flexible mandate designed to deliver attractive risk-adjusted returns by investing in first lien, second lien, unitranche, and mezzanine debt, as well as structured preferred stock and private equity co-investments. AB-PCI focuses on directly sourced and privately negotiated investments in the primary issue market, while selectively pursuing opportunities in the distributed and secondary loan markets on a relative value basis.

AB-PCI is a relatively small group of senior investment professionals with a close-knit culture. The principals of AB-PCI most recently worked together while leading a similar private credit investing platform that successfully committed just under $1.5B in 48 transactions and generated attractive risk-adjusted returns for investors. Prior to this, AB-PCI’s team members worked at premier investment banks, and in middle-market private equity and private credit investing.
Job Summary

AB-PCI is looking for an associate to work as part of the investment team. As an associate you work in small deal teams (usually 2 to 3, with 1-2 senior deal team members) on all aspects of credit investing. This provides an attractive opportunity for high caliber individuals to interact directly with senior team members as well as private equity investors, company management, sell-side banks, lawyers, accountants and other business professionals, as well as to be part of a new growth platform and assume significant levels of responsibility over time.
Job Description
Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:

• Play a key role in the execution of a transactions and management of portfolio investments: candidates must exhibit the capability to master all aspects of executing a transaction, including but not limited to business due diligence, financial analysis/modeling, industry research, preparation of investment memoranda and other written materials, and interacting with financial sponsors and management teams.
• Manage transactions with minimal supervision
column2: candidates successful in the role will progress to coordinate the activities of all team members, the investee company, and external advisors.

column1: • Develop an understand of the AB-PCI investment philosophy and credit discipline and be able to apply it in the context of both the assessment of investment opportunities and transaction execution.

• Strive to make a positive impact on the people around you by being a team player and an effective project manager, develop strong working relationships, and demonstrate strong commitment to the team’s goals consistent with AB-PCI’s emphasis on a cooperative and supportive work environment
Job Qualifications &
column2: Key Attributes

column1: The ideal candidate should have:
• Bachelors degree demonstrating superior academic performance.
• At least two years prior relevant work experience in Leveraged Finance, Financial Sponsor Coverage or M&
column2: A investment banking, private equity, or private credit investing while being a top performer.

column1: • Teamwork: Ability to work cooperatively with other members of the deal team and with others at all levels throughout the firm.

• Work Quality/Productivity: Consistently produces high-quality, accurate work in a timely manner. Demonstrates strong attention to detail. Demonstrates ability to manage multiple assignments and handles pressure well. Prioritizes tasks and is well organized.

• Quantitative/Problem Solving: Demonstrates a strong grounding in accounting, finance, and the capital markets. Masters the appropriate analytical techniques and financial models. Identifies key issues, skillfully analyzes problems, and arrives at conclusions which facilitate the execution of a transaction.
• Initiative/Work Ethic: Self-starter. Takes ownership of projects and drives the process but also knows when to ask for help. Requires minimal supervision.
• Judgment: Demonstrates insight in making decisions and asking questions regarding the investment, situation, and the client. Forms opinions and is discreet about confidential information.
• Written Communication Skills: Writes in an organized, concise, and persuasive manner. Develops the ability to draft various internal and external documents/memoranda quickly and with clarity.
• Oral Communication Skills: Participates effectively in meetings and presentations. Speaks articulately and with confidence. Makes persuasive arguments. Defends position and answers questions well.

• Client Skills: Forms effective relationships with counterparts at investee companies, including financial sponsors and senior executives. Responds quickly and accurately to requests. Anticipates client needs. Participates in client meetings and calls.
Location : Austin, TX

Dover Fueling Solutions (DFS), comprised of the most trusted names in the fuel industry, are global leaders in driving innovation for over 100 years. DFS, the industry's 1st end-to-end fueling solution, provides advanced fuel-dispensing equipment, including systems and payment, automatic tank gauging and wet stock-management solutions. The DFS business is comprised of industry leading brands including Tokheim, Wayne Fueling Systems, Fairbanks, ProGauge, ClearView and OPW Fuel Management Systems. We lead every market we serve with focused expertise, progressive thinking and customer-inspired innovation in order to push the boundaries of performance for our customers and shareholders. To learn more about DFS, visit www.doverfuelingsolutions.com. DFS is part of the Fluids segment of Dover Corporation (NYSE: DOV).
Summary:

This position reports to the Dover Fueling Solutions (DFS), Senior Director of Finance for North America and will be responsible for providing broad analytical and financial support across various areas of the business within the North American region. The focus will be on owning and driving the regional financial planning and analysis function with an emphasis on performance improvement, providing quality management information, and furthering the development of scalable reporting systems and processes, analytical tools, and key performance metrics. The ability to collaborate across all functional areas of the business constructively and efficiently, within a fast-paced, manufacturing-intensive environment is key. The candidate will participate in special projects as needed and prepare formal presentations for management review.

column1: 5e314c6873d86269,2020-08-01 23:28:00 UTC,"Austin, TX",Finance,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,US Community Mgr,"<div class=""jobsearch-jobDescriptionText"" id=""jobDescriptionText""><div>Manages the day-to-day operations of an assigned property including managing the team members, daily activities, and resources of the property to achieve established budgeted financial and operational goals, and ensures that the operation of the property complies with Company policies and procedures, Fair Housing, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and other laws and regulations governing multi-family housing operations.
JOB DESCRIPTION

• Provides input into the development of budget(s) for the property by analyzing and evaluating financial statements, reviewing current and projected marketing information, and accessing operational reports that establish historic and predict performance patterns.

• Meets targeted revenues by setting rent rates, ensuring rent and fees are collected and posted in a timely manner, making financial bank deposits, and preparing and reviewing monthly financial status reports.

• Approves invoices from vendors, contractors, and service providers for payment by reconciling work performed or products purchased, ensuring validity of certificates of insurance, coding charges to appropriate Chart of Account codes, and managing communication between the vendor/contractor, accounting, and the client/owner as needed.
• Controls expenditures by staying within the constraints of the approved budget and manages the balance and maintenance of the petty cash fund.

• Oversees the lease enforcement process by approving prospective resident applications, discounts and renewal leases, conducts periodic apartment inspections, follows proper notice requirements, evicts residents, and imposes and collects late fees and other charges as allowable and stated in the terms of the lease.

• Gathers, analyzes, and interprets current market and economic trends that may impact the property and implements short- and long-range marketing and leasing strategies to achieve the property’s occupancy and revenue goals.

• Promotes resident satisfaction and retention by responding to complaints, questions, and requests in a timely manner, and taking appropriate action to resolve and address service issues. Ensures the property’s maintenance team members comply with the Company’s standards with respect to responding and completing resident service requests.

• Conducts regular property inspections and takes appropriate actions to ensure that the physical aspects of the property, grounds, buildings, and amenities meet established standards for safety, cleanliness, and general appearance and appeal.

• Community Manager Supervises property staff by interviewing, hiring, orienting, and training employees, and manages their performance in accordance with Company policies, values, and business practices.

• Assists in managing the client/owner relationship by meeting with the owners, conducting property tours, providing updates and information about the property’s performance, and responding to owner requests as needed.

Here at BigCommerce, we are always on the lookout for top talent. The position you are applying for is in a high growth area of our business but may not be active at this time. So please note, when you apply for this position you will receive a response but will not receive feedback on your application until the position is active. In the meantime, the best way to stay up to date with BigCommerce, our career opportunities, and our plans to redefine the e-commerce industry is to join our global talent network, BigNetwork.
BigCommerce, named a 2019 ""Best Place to Work"" in Austin, is looking for an Analyst to help create data-driven insights and infrastructure in our rapidly growing company.
<h3 class=""jobSectionHeader""><b>
What You'll Do
• Provide analysis for BigCommerce's business units, to both technical and non-technical customers.
• Gather business requirements, extract and collate necessary data from disparate systems to answer business questions.
• Develop, deliver and communicate data insights and recommendations in a clear and concise manner, verbally and in written form.
• Maintain reporting infrastructure to make recommendations for improvements in regards to automation and documentation for the benefit of the entire Analytics team.
• Develop, automate, and document descriptive Analytics throughput via Jira/ Confluence, always looking for opportunities to help the team improve their processes.
• Partner closely with Data Solutions colleagues to share best practices and generate ideas that improve workflows for all technical teams at BigCommerce.
• Play a critical role in establishing best practices for data documentation and leading the team's efforts to scale in this area.
• Maintain a curious, systems thinking mindset to seek new and improved ways to visualize data sets.
Who You Are
• 1-2 years experience writing SQL (required) to analyze large datasets and answer business questions with a knack for documenting best practices / queries / FAQs.
• 1-2 years working with data in a business or financial analytics role, or equivalent academic background.
• Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Math, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or Computer Science.
• Proven expertise with data visualization tools and techniques required (Tableau, Looker, and/or Sisense specifically preferred)
• Experience with eCommerce and/or SaaS subscription models and related metrics a major plus
• Exposure to Python or similar scripting or programming languages a plus, not required
• Evangelize for data-driven decision making and quantify impacts of business decisions with a positive, patient servant leader attitude.
• A thoughtful communicator who earns trust and builds strong working relationships across departments. while selflessly facilitating knowledge transfer throughout the organization.
• Proactive and results-oriented, comfortable seeking to understand business context driving data requests and collaborating on best practices.
• Team player (required), ambitious, self-motivated, goal-oriented and analytical with excellent time-management skills.
Diversity &
column2: Inclusion at BigCommerce

column1: We have the opportunity to build not only a great business, but a great company, with soul. Our beliefs and commitment to diversity and inclusion are a central part of achieving that.

Our dedication to diversity and inclusion is grounded in two things: a moral belief in the dignity, value, and potential of every individual, and a practical belief that diverse, inclusive teams will create the best outcomes for our customers, partners, employees, and company. We welcome everyone to be a part of our journey.

Current BigCommerce Employees: Please use the internal job board to apply for openings

eb95c8fe2d8b374e,2020-08-01 23:28:00 UTC,"Austin, TX",Finance,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,"Strategic Sourcing Manager, Supplier Diversity","<div class=""jobsearch-jobDescriptionText"" id=""jobDescriptionText"">Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Launched in late 2016, Facebook Supplier Diversity helps qualified diverse-owned companies do business with Facebook and with the people and communities that Facebook connects. Our vision is to leverage the power and scale of our platforms and services to transform the way diverse suppliers connect to customers, each other, and the tools and resources to grow. Facebook has now spent more than $1.1 billion cumulatively with US companies certified as minority, women, veteran, LGBTQ, or disabled-owned (diverse suppliers). In 2019 alone, Facebook spent $515 million with diverse suppliers in categories spanning creative services, network infrastructure, facilities management and more. In January 2020, we began a global rollout of our supplier diversity program to increase opportunities for diverse suppliers located outside of the US. In June, we announced our commitment to increase our annual spend to at least $1 billion with diverse suppliers by the end of 2021. This commitment includes a specific goal to spend a minimum of $100 million with Black-owned companies. In support of this commitment, we’ve created a new role within the Supplier Diversity team responsible for hiring and leading a team of sourcing professionals explicitly tasked with supporting Facebook’s sourcing and outsourcing teams and business stakeholders to identify, qualify, and connect diverse suppliers with contracting opportunities in key categories, including, but not limited to: facilities construction and operations, marketing and creative agencies, and professional and IT services.This is a unique opportunity for a professional with a passion for creating economic opportunity to work with a wide variety of internal teams and directly contribute to achieving this important and high-profile goal.
• Develop and implement strategies to support business stakeholders in achieving diverse supplier spend goals with a data informed, sourcing supported approach
Maintain current and comprehensive knowledge of best-in-class diverse suppliers that will be project-competitive in key categories

Manage end-to-end Sourcing projects (including planning, execution, measurement, and optimization of projects)

Prepare and manage Sourcing documents, contracts, and related procurement documents
Ensure program success through strong performance management and governance methodologies, in collaboration with the business
Manage, coordinate and support special projects as needed

Establish strong collaborative relationships with Global Sourcing Category Teams, Global Outsourcing, Sourcing Contract Management Teams, Procurement Operations Teams, Procure-to-Pay and Sourcing Engineering Operations to develop sound operational processes
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain, Sourcing, Finance, Math, Management or related field

6+ years of experience leading or significantly collaborating with Supplier Diversity teams or programs with proven success sourcing, qualifying, and connecting diverse suppliers to meaningful contracts (at least $1 Million in annual value)

column1: R1 is a leading provider of technology-enabled revenue cycle management services which transform and solve challenges across health systems, hospitals and physician practices. Headquartered in Chicago, R1 is publicly-traded organization with employees throughout the US and international locations.

Our mission is to be the one trusted partner to manage revenue, so providers and patients can focus on what matters most. Our priority is to always do what is best for our clients, patient’s and each other. With our proven and scalable operating model, we complement a healthcare organization’s infrastructure, quickly driving sustainable improvements to net patient revenue and cash flows while reducing operating costs and enhancing the patient experience.

The Financial Counselor will be responsible for counseling patients or parties responsible for payment. The Patient Financial Counselor will educate patients on their responsibilities and potential options. The PFC is responsible for accurately and compassionately explaining to the patient their financial obligations during the financial counseling session. In addition, the counselor must obtain any necessary pre-certifications or authorizations and assist with any financing or third-party applications.
In this role, the successful candidate must display a strong sense of patient care and attention to detail.
Responsibilities:
Explain financial responsibilities for services received, payment options and collection procedures to patients or parties responsible for payment.
• Counsel patients regarding insurance benefits and recommend alternative sources of payment and financial assistance when appropriate.
• Contact insurance carriers or other sources and act as an advocate for the patient.
• Initiate process for collecting prepays due and perform follow up activity to insure maximum collection is achieved.
• Identify hospital, public and private financial assistance programs for patients unable to meet their financial obligations.

• Work with Case Management, Clinical Staff, Medicaid Vendor, and Family Independence Agency to assist patients and families in completing assistance program applications and determine eligibility and coverage.

• Notify manager, physician and servicing department of possible delay of service for any elective, urgent admissions, procedures and scheduled diagnostic testing which have not been approved prior to the date of service.
• Maintain accurate documentation of pre-processing information.
Provide assistance to uninsured patients and families in completing and filing Medicaid or assistance program applications with the appropriate agency.
• Perform all other duties and projects as assigned.
Required Qualifications:
High school diploma is required
At least one year of call center experience
Attention to detail
Strong customer service experience
Ability to multi-task and navigate between multiple systems simultaneously
Ability to handle a large volume of incoming calls
Desired Qualifications:
Previous experience as a financial counselor with background in medical terminology preferred
• Understanding of State and Federal assistance
Physical Requirements:
See, read, and/or operate computers, telephones, office equipment, documents, labels, including manipulating paper requiring the ability to move fingers and hands.
Remain sitting, standing, or walking for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.

• Frequent interactions with associates, patient care providers, patients, and visitors that require associate to verbally communicate as well as hear and understand spoken information, alarms, needs, and issues quickly and accurately, particularly during emergency situations.

Manual dexterity of hands and fingers to manipulate complex and delicate equipment with precision and accuracy. This includes frequent computer use and typing for documenting patient care, accessing needed information banding patients, etc.

Need to walk and assist with transporting/ambulating patients and obtaining and distributing supplies and equipment. This includes pushing/pulling gurneys and portable equipment, including heavy items (over 50 lbs.).

Working in an evolving healthcare setting, we use our shared expertise to deliver innovative solutions. Our fast-growing team has opportunities to learn and grow through rewarding interactions, collaboration and the freedom to explore professional interests.

Our associates are given valuable opportunities to contribute, to innovate and create meaningful work that makes an impact in the communities we serve around the world. We also offer a culture of excellence that drives customer success and improves patient care. We believe in giving back to the community and offer a competitive benefits package. To learn more, visit: r1rcm.com.
