This is a 6 month contract position.

As a Recruiting Coordinator at Unity Technologies, you will play a fundamental part in recruiting amazing talent at Unity by ensuring a smooth and positive candidate experience from beginning to end. You will be the liaison of communication between hiring managers, panelists, candidates, and our recruiting team when coordinating interviews.

You will collaborate with internal/external clients and candidates. If you have exceptional communication skills, place a premium on customer service and have the ability to shift gears at a moment's notice, we would love to hear from you!
Responsibilities
<ul>
• You will coordinate a high volume of candidate phone screens as well as in-person/video interviews at the executive level and below with efficiency and accuracy
• Maintain our applicant tracking system to ensure that all candidate information is up-to-date
• Partner with Recruiting and Finance team members to open new job requisitions and post the associated job descriptions to our careers site
• Ensure a high touch, white glove candidate experience from start to finish
• Communicate professionally and maintain a high level of confidentiality at all times
Requirements
<ul>
• Exceptional interpersonal, written/verbal communication skills
• Unrelenting attention to detail - we continuously coordinate between complex schedules and tough requests without missing a beat
• Candidate-centric attitude and drive to provide unparalleled candidate experiences. You can make anyone feel comfortable and taken care of
• Strong problem solving and organizational skills - you can fix any last minute issues without breaking a sweat
• You embrace change with a great attitude and feel comfortable with ambiguity
Bonus Points
<ul>
• Experience with Google for Work applications like Gmail, Calendar, Docs, and Sheets
• Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems like Greenhouse
• Prior experience in a Recruiting/HR Coordinator role in a fast paced environment
• Familiarity with HR management systems like Workday
About Unity Technologies

Unity is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

The company's 1,400+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than three billion times per month in 2019 on more than two billion unique devices. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Auditor V

Auditor V Performs highly advanced and/or managerial (senior-level) auditing work. Serves as the agency’s Internal Auditor in compliance with Title 10, Chapter 2102, of the Texas Government Code. Establishes an internal auditing program to provide an independent analysis and evaluation of the agency’s internal controls and the quality of performance in carrying out its assigned responsibilities. Conducts, plans, schedules, coordinates, and reviews audits and results
column2: and provides guidance and assistance related to governmental auditing. May plan, assign, and/or supervise the work of others. Works under minimal supervision, with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

column1: Essential Job Functions:
Completes an Annual Risk Assessment of all agency programs and services using standard risk assessment techniques to identify programs and services with the greatest risk potential. 10%
Develops an Annual Audit Plan utilizing Risk Assessment results to prioritize the reviews of agency programs and services, and to allocate audit resources. 10%
Prepares the mandated Annual Audit Report in the prescribed form and content and submits it by the required deadline. 10%

Develops audit scopes, programs, objectives, procedures, and deliverables. Performs audits, documents results, prepares audit reports, reviews recommendations and draft reports with clients, finalizes reports and presents them to agency management and governing board. 35%
Examines and analyzes operations, internal control structures and systems, and records for reliability, adequacy, accuracy, efficiency, and compliance with legal regulations. 20%
Conducts post-audit assessments and follows up to evaluate the timely implementation of recommendations and their effectiveness. 10%
Acts as liaison with outside auditors and coordinates management responses for external audits. May plan, assign, and/or supervise work of others 5%

<li>Ability to gather and analyze accurate and relevant audit information.

<li>Skill in effective communication and interaction with agency staff, other agency representatives, state and federal auditors, and local governments’ staff and elected/appointed officials.
<li>Skill in the use of computers, associated software applications, and sampling techniques.
Registration or Licensure Requirements:
Must be a current Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Certified Internal Auditor (CIA).

Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in accounting, business administration, finance, economics, or a related field PLUS two years of Internal Audit work experience.
Education and relevant work experience may be substituted for one another.
Possession of a CPA or CIA
Additional Information:
This is a as needed hourly position. Will not work all weeks. Employee is able to choose own hours in non emergency situations. Audit hours are approved by the Board based on risk assessment.

757c3b6fcc1766d1,2020-08-01 07:27:00 UTC,"Austin, TX 78701 (Downtown area)",Accountant,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Corporate Controller,"

About the Position
This job is located in Tyler, Texas.

SmartDrone, founded in 2020 by experienced executives in the commercial drone space is launching as a fully-funded business, with market-validated technology, and a go-to-market plan for you to join at the ground floor. We focus on developing automatic aerial digitization solutions. Data from an array of sensors is processed onboard to produce digitized models for various commercial and industrial uses. SmartDrone is preparing to go to market with the first version of the SmartDrone focusing on addressing the market for rapid data collection and accurate digitization.

We are looking for a candidate to manage our costs and risks as we grow the company! A Controller to own daily accounting responsibilities, monthly financial close, and regular strategic projects, as well as selecting, hiring, and managing our accounting staff.

You will work collaboratively with the Product Development, Engineering, Sales, and Executive teams to track departmental costs against budgets, becoming the ultimate arbiter of cost management and cash. You must be comfortable being assertive and being the “no” person and you will have the full support of our executive team to assert mindfulness of budgets in company decision making processes.

You will create and constantly improve upon the existing processes, policies, and internal controls for our business units (B2B sales, government sales, online sales). You will create foundational processes, policies, and controls for our shared Corporate resources and continue to revisit and improve these throughout your career with us.

Because we are a scrappy startup, we are looking for someone to partner closely with our Operations management and CEO to guide the organization through bursts of rapid growth. You will need to be versatile, a quick learner, have an impeccable eye for detail, and be willing to roll up your sleeves every day. You will also need to be capable of putting solid analyses in the hands of your business partners at work with succinct recommendations for action. Being successful in this role will require a driven individual, who prioritizes critical thinking, and who strives for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities
Manage the timely monthly, quarterly, and annual financial close process including reconciling revenue, preparation of journal entries, and account reconciliations.

• Provide timely monthly analysis of selected financial data including development, fulfillment, overhead, and marketing expenses and discuss findings with the business leaders to make real time changes to the business operations and maximize profits.
Maintain an open line of communication with the CEO, operations and executive team including producing accurate key data for them to make informed decisions on a regular basis.
Responsible for select vendor negotiations on behalf of the business with the goal of managing cash and maximizing profit.
Own variance analyses vs. prior periods, plan and forecast for the consolidated company and for each business unit (B2B sales, government sales, online sales)
Onboard company books within Sage 100 ERP system’s accounting function and create tools and reports to easily and accurately analyze business unit performance.
• Develop accounting policies in accordance with US GAAP and implement new standards issued by the FASB as necessary.
Responsible for risk mitigation through insurance policies, including planning for and execution of annual polices with insurance brokers.
• Responsible for payroll and HR administration functions.
• Responsible for annual maintenance of company books and reporting to federal and state government entities.

• Collaborate with department heads to create annual and monthly budgets. Hold teams accountable to the overall profit goals for the business by discussing the budget to actual results and revise forward looking budgets as a result.
Manage daily and weekly cash flows, including supervision of vendor billings and accurate data entry.

Approve all material and inventory invoices after signoff by Product Managers or supervisors, initiate payments to inventory vendors while considering cash flow implications and supervise inventory cost accounting.
Oversee expense reporting, including developing and revisiting the employee expense reimbursement policies.
Supervise invoicing, collections, and credit analysis
column2: monitor wholesale policies including credit and risk assessments.

column1: Supervise all tax reporting, compliance and analysis (income, payroll, and sales).
Implement and then manage the annual audit process including providing auditor requests.
Compile and write the annual financial statements.
Own the day-to-day communication and deliverables with several key external partners, such as our auditors, insurance broker, and banks.
• Perform ad hoc financial analysis for executives and CEO.

• Manage HR and administration policies, manage all hiring interfacing with hiring managers to draft job descriptions and make first pass filters of candidates. As we grow and evolve this will transition to hiring an HR professional and overseeing their work.
• At this time the Controller will be our only accounting function, work with executives to build the team of your dreams by interviewing, hiring, and managing accounting team as we grow rapidly.

• Manage by taking full ownership of the accounting functions within SmartDrone and with a focus on feedback, coaching and developing careers at SmartDrone so that we have the fastest, most accurate, and most diligent accounting team around.

• Work with our team of professionals and executives through many sprints, explosive growth, and stretch periods, and be able to “do it ‘til it hurts” until there is budget for direct reports and staff to delegate to.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting and a minimum of eight (8) years’ experience in Accounting with a career focus on cost accounting &amp
column2: inventory management.

column1: • Five (5) years’ supervisory / managerial experience in the Accounting field.
• 5+ years of relevant experience with company and similar industry managing revenues of $50M+ annually.
• Ability to sprint, manage explosive growth, and work outside “banker’s hours” on an as-needed basis working outside of the “nine to five” to support your team.
• Not afraid to get your hands dirty and build drones or help the team as needed.
• Experience in financial analysis and/or managing financial analysts a plus.
Experience with Sage 100 ERP and/or Sage Intacct a plus.
• Expert level QuickBooks user.
• Expert level Excel skills and ability to directly apply them as they relate to financial planning and analysis / modeling.
• Ability to team up and work with other departments to meet the company’s goals and objectives.
• Pt. 107 FAA Licensed Pilot a plus.
• Required to maintain fulltime office presence at corporate office located in Tyler, Texas.
• Passion for trying things out, getting your hands dirty, engaging with your team members, and desire to WIN!

Position Summary

Samsung Austin Semiconductor is one of the most advanced semiconductor manufacturing facilities in the world with more than 3,000 employees and 2.45 million square feet of floor space. Samsung Austin Semiconductor has broad semiconductor process technology offerings serving customers in various application areas including mobile, consumer, networking/high performance computing, Internet of Things, RF and automotive. Since 1996, SAS has invested approximately $17 billion in its Austin, TX campus, making it one of the largest direct foreign investments in United States history. Samsung Austin Semiconductor is a US-based subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. The Austin facility is one of the few semiconductor plants the company has outside South Korea. Visit www.samsung.com/us/sas.
SAS is focused on being the World’s Best Foundry product supplier.
Role and Responsibilities

• This open position is for a Sr Bright-Field Applications Engineer leading PWQ/PRISM/FEM project, working with multiple customers (PHOTO, Device Owner, and Manufacturing) for NPI planning, recipe developing, testing, data collection, and reporting to secure process approval for new product and excursion prevention on existing product.
• Metrology is a great place to work with a friendly environment.
• You will have a chance to work on material from all other departments of the FAB since Metrology supports all unit parts and other groups (PIE, Device team, QA, FA, and MFG).
• Metrology is to provide support to the fab with accurate and precise measurement data.
• Since the nature of metrology work depends heavily on every aspect (equipment, process, applications, etc.), good teamwork and communication skill is required to be successful.
• Metrology has several great experienced teams that work together, and this creates many opportunities to work with state-of-the-art equipment and to utilize very innovative measurement techniques.
• This environment will help you accelerate your experience and knowledge so that you can have a strong contribution to the team and company.
• Since the nature of metrology work depends heavily on every aspect (equipment, process, applications, etc.), good teamwork and communication skill is required to be successful.

• This open position is for a Bright-Field Applications Engineer, specifically focusing on defect detection, engineering analysis, troubleshooting/resolving issues daily in a factory environment, providing strong customer service to internal and external customers, decision making, daily tool health and monitoring, automating routine tasks, improving BKMs (best known methods) and recipe setup for new &
column2: old devices.

column1: • Candidate must be able to run Design of Experiment (DoE) and analyze the data to achieve the best solution.
• The BF application team provides most of the critical measurements for device performance, yield, and quality, so your contribution will be counted on at every step.
• Metrology engineers and experienced application technicians will train you step by step so please be a part of our fun and exciting team!
• Defect recipe developer for D30, DF, Bright Field tool application set.
• Engineering Recipe Setup and report for PWQ/FEM/PRISM inspection.
• Work with inspection infra applications and DE engineer team for defect trending and quality improvement projects.
• Work with recipes development and optimization for both lines S1 &
• Technical presentations for information sharing and cultivation.
• Interface with YDD, PIE, FA and manufacturing and other unit part engineering departments for metrology related items, Documentation of work details.
• Maintain tool-to-tool matching (TTTM) in spec, and changing point management CPM).
• Daily monitoring of key metrics daily quals and product trend and respond to SPC, PCM, and ALPS to prevent excursions.
• Troubleshooting measurement issues.
• Work with equipment engineers and technicians to isolate equipment issues, and to work with vendors to improve equipment performance.
• Able to understand and monitor tool health in assigned area.
• Troubleshoot daily customer( UP/PIE) issues and provide reports with detail analysis.

• 5+ year experience with defect inspection tool set a plus, especially BF (BBP 29XX and 39XX) tools set Four years of semiconductor experience preferred and knowledge in process and defects.
• Experience with metrology inspection tool set a plus, especially D30, DF BF tools set specific.

We Believe:

In improving the human experience through thoughtful design.

Pixoul is more than another digital agency, we're a design-centric community that is looking to use our shared passion for better user experiences to transform our world--in both digital and analog realms.

We take on complex challenges, tackle never-been-done-before opportunities, and ideate around new solutions. We use design thinking to unlock creative potential and build problem-solving solutions that can revolutionize products, businesses, and entire economic ecosystems.

At the heart of Pixoul, we know that our extraordinary work is only accomplished by extraordinary people. Our talented team members are diverse creatives, critical thinkers, and scrappy go-getters. We expect hard work, determination, and a love for design thinking and problem solving.

The Position:

Pixoul’s Senior Experience Designers craft how the individual interacts with a product or service. This requires leading lead product / service research, concepting, information architecture development (site maps, user flows, sketches, wireframes, navigation models), systematic design, testing, and interaction design to create powerful digital, physical and/or environmental experiences.

This is not a support role: you will be hands-on
column2:
executing designs and establishing a strong point of view for the User Experience on the program many times directly with our clients. Senior Interaction Designers are able to discover, understand, and communicate the business requirements of our clients, the emotional desires of their customers, and the context in which these two come together. You will be the voice of expertise through the design and facilitation of workshops with all levels of the client organization.

Having a strong passion for and understanding of user-centered design processes, systemic thinking, and interaction design principles is crucial for your success.

You:

Are someone who is passionate about user-centered design and driven to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. You bring to the organization the following competencies:

  • At least five years of user experience and user-centered design expertise.
  • Expertise in systemic thinking and strong knowledge of interaction design principles and methodology.
  • Strong project and people management skills. Must be able to function as a project leader as well as an individual contributor.
  • Expertise in research and testing methods across qualitative/quantitative, and attitudinal/behavioral axis.
  • Proficiency with design and prototyping tools such as AdobeCC, Sketch, InVision, and Zeplin.
  • A Bachelor degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, or a related design or behavioral science discipline.
  • A passion for creating products that resonate emotionally with people.
  • Solid understanding of practical benefits and limitations of internet technologies.
  • Intimate knowledge of how comps translate to code.
  • Self-motivation, excellent communication, an open mind, the ability to thrive in multidisciplinary teams, and the skills to balance great design with short deadlines.
  • Strong interpersonal and client management skills.
  • A love of collaboration and learning.
  • A fearless and positive attitude.

Perks:

  • Unlimited Personal Days: Need a day? Take it. No questions asked.
  • Unlimited Vacation: All we ask is for clear communication.
  • Growth: We make it a priority to allow our contractors access to full-time roles, when available.
  • Flexibility: Work remotely, as much as you want. Your work with us should be a creative outlet, not a ball and chain.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $52.00 - $64.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Design Thinking: 5 years (Preferred)
  • UI: 5 years (Preferred)
  • UX: 5 years (Preferred)
","Pixoul, Inc."

We Believe:

In improving the human experience through thoughtful design.

Pixoul is more than another digital agency, we're a design-centric community that is looking to use our shared passion for better user experiences to transform our world--in both digital and analog realms.

We take on complex challenges, tackle never-been-done-before opportunities, and ideate around new solutions. We use design thinking to unlock creative potential and build problem-solving solutions that can revolutionize products, businesses, and entire economic ecosystems.

At the heart of Pixoul, we know that our extraordinary work is only accomplished by extraordinary people. Our talented team members are diverse creatives, critical thinkers, and scrappy go-getters. We expect hard work, determination, and a love for design thinking and problem solving.

The Position:

Pixoul's Sr. Visual Designers guide the team in creating complex interactive experiences for applications, software and web interfaces. Alongside project managers and a team of strategists, researchers, designers, and testers, they are responsible for leading projects, understanding and communicating business objectives, and translating business problems into visual solutions.

Qualified candidates will share our belief that design is as much about behavior and emotion as it is about utility and ease of use. Senior Visual Designers are responsible for the development of innovative navigation systems, interface designs, typography, and screen layouts for software, application, web sites, and other interactive media. They will push the state-of-the-art with every creation and thrive in our fast-paced studio. This important role requires broad knowledge and advanced skills in visual design, user experience, and user interface design.

You:

Are someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. You bring to the organization the following competencies:

  • At least five years of experience in designing visual language systems for digital products and services.
  • Wildly creative and obsessively meticulous.
  • Exceptional design talents with stylistic breadth that demonstrates sensitivity to diverse subject matter- from product interaction to software tools and applications to the web.
  • Superb information design abilities, fastidious and efficient production and optimization habits, and impeccable problem solving skills.
  • Jedi skills with relevant design software packages.
  • A passion for creating products that resonate emotionally with people.
  • Solid understanding of practical benefits and limitations of internet technologies.
  • Intimate knowledge of how comps translate to code.
  • Self-motivation, excellent communication, an open mind, the ability to thrive in multidisciplinary teams, and the skills to balance great design with short deadlines.
  • Strong interpersonal and client management skills.
  • A love of collaboration and learning.
  • A fearless and positive attitude.

Your Portfolio:

  • Demonstrates a passion for digital product development
  • Exhibits stylistic breadth, attention to detail, and balances beauty, innovation and usability
  • Shows experience with diverse content and subject matter
  • Proves their facility in translating high level ideas into unique visual styles and directions, and breaking those down to elemental level
  • Consists of product and software-based samples, show progressive growth and depth in understanding.

Perks:

  • Unlimited Personal Days: Need a day? Take it. No questions asked.
  • Unlimited Vacation: All we ask is for clear communication.

d2255e77d6cdc9a1,2020-08-01 23:15:00 UTC,"Austin, TX 78702 (East Cesar Chavez area)",ux+designer,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Senior Product UI Designer,"
Company Description

At Literati, we believe in the power of great books. We’re on a mission to curate transformative literary experiences for every reader: anyone who dreams, anyone who wonders, of any age. There are some stories no child should live without and no adult should ever forget.
Job Description

We are looking for a talented, down-to-earth Product Designer to work both on web products and mobile apps. This is a startup: You’ll enjoy donning many hats and work closely with our Engineering and Product leadership. You have strong design chops. You enjoy thinking deeply on product design decisions that can work at scale. You have an impeccable design sense, and a keen eye for detail and craft. Collaboration is in your DNA, but you aren’t afraid to prioritize, provide feedback, make decisions, and communicate. You’ll come in and make an immediate impact on our small (but mighty) design team, and play a large role in representing our brand visually as a whole.
Qualifications
WE’RE GOOD AT:

Bringing the fire. We are a startup, with all the fierce dedication and sparkling energy to accomplish great feats. Iron sharpens iron, and so we’ve refined our teams from only the strongest metals: open minds, bright ideas, and bold determination.
YOU’RE GOOD AT:
A Designer. You have an impeccable design sense, and a keen eye for detail and craft.
Passionate. Designing global products that are intuitive and bring joy and value to consumers’ lives floats your boat.
Empathetic. You understand your customer’s needs, then skillfully translate them into specific interaction and UI designs.
Adaptable. You thrive on informed iteration in order to design experiences that work, and at scale.
A Creator. Building elegant solutions for a beautiful customer experience is in your genes.
Tool Agnostic. Sure you have preferences in order to be efficient, but you care more about what you're making than what you're using to make it.
A Collaborator. It’s in your DNA, but you aren’t afraid to prioritize, make decisions and communicate with authority.
A Communicator. You understand the importance of being able to both brainstorm with the wider team as well as articulate your individual design decisions.
Humble. Very humble. Ego? Not your amigo.
Bookish. You live for the infinite ways in which books are a mirror for our humanity.
YOU WILL NEED:
Strong design chops, deep product understanding, and acute customer empathy
3+ years of experience in an individual contributor role, on a Product Design team for desktop or mobile.
Expertise in standard design software such as Sketch, InVision, Adobe, Framer, and the like. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.
A record of applying your design skills to create product and business impact.
Ability to work with internal and external stakeholders to understand detailed requirements and design a complete product design that meets product needs and vision.
Ability to develop simple and delightful design solutions to complex communication problems.
Previous eCommerce Mobile and Web design experience preferred.
Bonus: You’ve had experience building design systems or UI kits for digital products
YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WILL LOOK LIKE:
Work cross-functionally with Creative, Engineering, and Product on design needs throughout the different phases of our product.
Collaborate closely with Creative and Product leadership to define new features and refine existing ones.
Leverage and evolve our growing design system in order to design flows, prototypes, sketches, and hi-fidelity visuals for web and mobile.
Contribute in often rapid and impactful research across our customer lifecycle.
Support your design work using all available insights including quantitative data and site metrics, customer feedback, and usability findings.
Provide innovative, customer-centric, information and interaction design recommendations that contribute to an enhanced user experience.
Always advocate for the users' needs, and be able to tell our brand story through your work.
Additional Information

We seek people with drive and a touch of alchemy—and if that sounds like you, you should join us. Even if your experience isn’t a precise match for the role, passion and prowess will always win the day in our book. And if your career has taken you to some spectacular (or spectacularly strange) places? We love a good story.

At Literati, we value the power of reading for all: anyone who dreams, anyone who wonders, anyone of any age, from any background. We are dedicated to cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and connectedness that sees, reflects, welcomes, and celebrates the innovation and talent of a diverse array of people.

",Literati

d9fb79a2611e59dc,2020-08-01 23:14:00 UTC,"Austin, TX 78756 (Brentwood area)",data+analyst,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Director of Regulatory Services Data Analytics,"

The Director II of the Regulatory Services Data Analytics (RSDA) unit is selected by and reports to the Chief Data &
column2: Analytics Officer (CDAO), Center for Analytics and Decision Support. The Director performs highly advanced senior-level managerial activities providing direction and guidance in strategic operations and planning for the RSDA unit. The Director is responsible for establishing the strategic plan and objectives for the unit, developing and establishing priorities, implementing and evaluating initiatives impacting health and human services program outcomes and policies in Texas in accordance with state and federal laws. The Director oversees the effective use of data for reporting and analyses, provides direction and guidance on the development and use of analytic methods and procedures, and analyzing information systems for data quality. The Director provides consultation, and recommendations to senior-level management, including the Deputy Executive Commissioner (DEC) for the Office of Performance, the DEC for Regulatory Services, and Executive level staff. The Director represents the agency on workgroups and committees to coordinate and develop health and human services policy initiatives related to data analytics
column3: provides direction on the preparation of adhoc and recurring reports, position papers, and memorandums on regulations and program policies
column4: makes public presentations on various aspects of health and human services issues, especially on those related to regulatory services
column5: supervises technical staff in data gathering, the development of data systems to fulfill legislative or other policy mandates, and researching, analyzing, and furnishing findings to Executive level staff.

column1: Essential Job Functions:
EJF 1. Directs the Regulatory Services Data Analytics (RSDA) unit activities
column2: provides leadership. Plans, implements and evaluates initiatives impacting health and human services programs in Texas in accordance with state and federal laws. Develops and establishes goals and objectives consistent with legislative mandates and the HHSC strategic plan. Develops and establishes the unit's priorities and standards for achieving goals. Plans, develops, implements and coordinates policies of the unit. Collaborates with HHSC areas and HHS agencies in implementing initiatives and projects that support the unit's goals and objectives. Develops and implements techniques for analyzing program activities
column3: identifies need to revise program in order to improve outcomes. Provides input and recommendations to executive management on the development and implementation of policies directed at improving health and human services programs and policies. Time Spent: 30%

column1: EJF 2. Ensures coordination and collaboration of unit activities
column2: oversees the analysis of data for use in management and program planning. Oversees the development, preparation and dissemination of information and materials in response to requests from HHS programs, legislators, executive management or other external stakeholders. Oversees, monitors, evaluates, and develops resources and planning strategies to improve data reporting and analyses
column3: participates in planning and development of agency administrative processes when analyzing data for efficiency and effectiveness. Time Spent: 20%

column1: EJF 3. Develops and maintains partnerships with HHS programs, governmental agencies, academic institutions, stakeholder organizations, and researchers. Ensures coordination and collaboration of unit activities for the planning, development, and implementation of programs related to data collection and reporting. Promotes collaboration between stakeholders to build a shared strategy for policy planning and evaluation, improvement of management accountability, and the means to reach program objectives and requirements. Oversees the coordination and participation in special assignments and projects relating to information systems and data collection. Time Spent: 10%

EJF 4. Reviews results of studies and data analyses to provide direction and guidance. Initiates, develops, and prepares reports, briefing documents, issue papers, correspondence, bill analyses, and memorandums for executive management review and decision-making. Time Spent: 10%

EJF 5. Represents HHSC as a subject matter expert at public hearings and meetings with legislative officials, state and federal agency officials, consumer representatives, advocacy groups, committees and conferences or seminars. Participates as a panelist or speaker on various state and local workshops. Time Spent: 10%
EJF 6. Develops and reviews budgets and provides final approval of unit budget. Time Spent: 10%
EJF 7. Plans, assigns and supervises the work of others. Some travel will be required. Time Spent: 10%
Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of local, state, and federal laws and regulations.
Knowledge of strategic planning, performance budgeting, and the Legislative Appropriations Request process.
Knowledge of research methods, principles, techniques and philosophies.
Knowledge of statistical concepts, methods, and their application to data analysis.
Knowledge of measurement, testing, and evaluation, and of computer application on statistical models.
Skill in analyzing and interpreting statistical, analytical methods and procedures, and use of demographic information, forecasting, and trend analysis.
Skill in organizing research findings, and developing creative solutions for presentation and implementation.
Skill in developing presentations.
Skill in writing concise reports.
Ability to interpret program directives and policies.
Ability to plan and coordinate activities.
Ability to organize tasks and projects.
Ability to communicate orally and in writing, including presenting research results non-technical language.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of staff.
Ability to provide leadership.
Registration or Licensure Requirements:
NA
Initial Selection Criteria:

Four years college in epidemiology, social and behavioral sciences, natural sciences, or related field is preferred. Master’s degree or higher is preferred. Five years’ experience with collection, analysis, and dissemination of data used to improve, inform, and support health and human services related programs. Demonstrated experience with Regulatory Services data is preferred. Two years of experience in a lead, management or supervisory role.
Additional Information:
MOS Code:

There are no direct military occupation(s) that relate to the initial selection criteria and registration or licensure requirements for this position. All active duty, reservists, guardsmen, and veterans are encouraged to apply. For more information see the Texas State Auditor’s Military Crosswalk at http://www.hr.sao.state.tx.us/Compensation/JobDescriptions.aspx.
HHS agencies use E-Verify. You must bring your I-9 documentation with you on your first day of work.
I-9 Form - Click here to download the I-9 form.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), HHS agencies will provide reasonable accommodation during the hiring and selection process for qualified individuals with a disability. If you need assistance completing the on-line application, contact the HHS Employee Service Center at 1-888-894-4747. If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodation to participate in the interview process, please notify the person scheduling the interview.

• Perform front/back end design and development using advanced programming techniques.
• Develop and maintain web-enabled capabilities. Plan, design, development, test and implement various static and dynamic content web sites for web services technologies.
• Maintain IIS Intranet server layer security in compliance with Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) and vulnerability assessment requirements.
• Train user groups how to effectively use the constructed solutions.
• Maintain regular and punctual attendance.
• Perform all other duties as assigned.

Minimum qualifications:
<li>
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
• 2 years of industry experience in Technical Support, Professional Services, Engineering, Sustaining Engineering and/or Systems Engineering.
• Experience with developing web applications and programming languages (Python, Go, Java, JVM Hotspot, HTTP, HTTPS).
Preferred qualifications:
<li>
Experience with cloud technology solutions and/or running and supporting large complex systems at scale.

• Experience with any of the following cloud storage solutions: SQL database administration, Google App Engine, open source software communities, cloud networking solutions and/or distributed computing technology.
• Experience in cloud application integration with Webhooks.
• Experience with mobile application development, white label app and application marketplace.

• Effective network administration skills with an understanding of Unix/Linux and/or Windows systems from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols.
• Excellent network administration and troubleshooting skills.
About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

With the rise of no-code technology, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is growing its technology stack, and helping business users (citizen developers) build Mobile/Web based solutions without requiring any previous coding knowledge.

AppSheet is part of Google Cloud’s Business Application Platform product portfolio which includes other technologies like of the Apigee API platform (acquired by Google Cloud in 2016). Acquired in 2019, AppSheet is a leading no-code application development platform used by a number of enterprises across a variety of industries. AppSheet complements Google Cloud’s strategy to reimagine the application development space with a platform that helps enterprises innovate with no-code development, workflow automation, application integration and API management as they modernize their business processes in the cloud.

As a Technical Solutions Engineer, you will combine software development, networking, and systems administration expertise with an aptitude for technical consulting, troubleshooting, and analysis. You will work across multiple customer-facing teams to improve the product's vision, while also ensuring that global businesses and organizations continue to be successful. You are a technical solutions authority, helping Googlers and customers approach and resolve technology problems and design Google-scale services. This is a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of no-code application development.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities

• Own the customer’s problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of new investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on no-code application development Platform.

• Develop an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis and identify and resolve future issues quickly.
• Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in Engineering, Sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
• Help customers, who are not programmers, to design, implement, and test applications using AppSheet.
• Help the customer through each of the stages of the application development process. Application consultant to customers who want to design a no-code application.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.",Google

What’s your mission?

IronNet’s mission is simple: To deliver the power of collective cybersecurity to defend companies, sectors, and nations. For decades, companies have been defending against cyber attacks on their own while adversaries have been organizing themselves into sophisticated hacker networks … until now, with IronNet Collective Defense. In 2014, General (Ret) Keith Alexander, former Commander U.S. Cyber Command, launched IronNet to strengthen cybersecurity defense against highly sophisticated adversaries, across all borders and sectors.

In response to cyber adversaries who increasingly collaborate for collective offense, leading organizations in our critical infrastructure are using collective defense strategies and solutions to meet these powerful and ever-changing threats. We believe that collective defense is our collective responsibility and we are leading the charge.

We are looking for a very well-rounded, experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join a team of SREs dedicated to support and improvement of our back end and sensor platforms. We work on petabyte-scale distributed systems. This person must dive deep into operational issues, from systems, automation, and process perspectives. The candidate will understand the challenges around integrating disparate infrastructures into a new facility and new processes and procedures.
Responsibilities
Daily customer interaction ensuring the health and maintenance of customer’s stack: hardware, software, application and network are operating in peak performance
Perform deep dives into both systemic and latent reliability issues
column2: partner with software and systems engineers across the organization to produce and roll out fixes

column1: Troubleshoot issues across the entire stack: hardware, software, application and network
Drive standardization efforts across multiple disciplines and services in conjunction with embedded SREs throughout the organization
Identify and drive opportunities to improve automation for the company
column2: scope and create automation for deployment, management and visibility of our services

column1: Represent the SRE organization in design reviews and operational readiness exercises for new and existing services
Work with software engineers and development SRE's to improve upon deployment processes.

Sound fundamentals in operating systems, networking, and distributed systems
Strong familiarity with Linux systems administration and management / best practices
Familiarity with OS container technology: Docker, LXC, namespaces/cgroups
Strong understanding of: Ethernet, VLAN, IPv4/IPv6, ARP, DHCP, DNS, and TCP

STIG familiarity is a plus
Solid understanding of systems and application design, including the operational trade-offs of various designs

Practical knowledge of various aspects of service design, including messaging protocols &amp
column2: behavior, caching strategies and software design practices

Demonstrable knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, web application security, and experience supporting multi-tier web application architectures
Excellent knowledge of Linux/UNIX systems administration and performance tuning
Comfortable configuring DNS, DHCP, and LAN/WAN technologies

Must work well with and be able to influence myriad personalities at all levels

Must be adaptable and able to focus on the simplest, most efficient &amp

Recognition &amp
column2: Awards

More About IronNet:

IronNet delivers unmatched collective cyber threat detection for enterprise on-premise, cloud, and hybrid networks. We do this through the application of advanced behavioral analytics, AI, and machine learning techniques. Our team combines the tradecraft knowledge of the best offensive and defensive cyber operators in the world with world-class mathematicians and data scientists to engineer solutions that empower companies to defend against advanced threats.

Our founder and Co-CEO, General (Ret) Keith Alexander, is a recognized cybersecurity innovator and a frequent speaker about current cyberthreats and effective defenses. We have a leadership team with deep government and commercial cyber experience, and the company is advised by a board of esteemed security and venture investment professionals, including Jan Tighe Retired Vice Admiral, Former Deputy Chief of Naval Operations for Information Warfare and Director, Naval Intelligence, US Navy

b602d39713734dd3,2020-08-01 15:27:00 UTC,"Austin, TX",Support+Engineer,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Senior Power Electronics Engineer,"

Please Note: US citizenship or permanent residency is required for this position.

CesiumAstro is a rapidly growing space technology startup in Austin, Texas, developing out-of-the-box communication systems for satellites, UAVs, launch vehicles, and other space and airborne platforms. Our approach is unique, and our team is changing the world of space communications. Learn more about our company at https://www.cesiumastro.com.

We are looking to add a Senior Power Electronics Design Engineer to our team. If you are great at what you do, enjoy working in a startup environment, and are passionate about developing leading-edge power electronics for satellites, spacecraft, and aerospace systems, we would like to hear from you.

In this position, you will be responsible for power electronics circuits and systems through all stages of the development process. The two primary product areas for this position are: (1) optimized point-of-load converters for RF and digital modules (typically ranging from 1W to 50W), and (2) standalone dc-dc converter modules (typically 20W to 500W). Design elements and responsibilities will include isolated and non-isolated DC-DC converters, magnetics design and analysis, system-level power management and distribution design, point-of-load regulators, switching and linear regulators, filters, and stability analysis and measurement.

As a senior hardware team member, you will be responsible for hardware designs from concept through production, including product roadmaps, block diagrams, part selection, schematic design, PCB layout and routing, analysis, manufacturing (working with contract manufacturers), test, qualification, and in-orbit support. Senior engineers also serve as technical and professional mentors in their field.

The successful candidate will also present engineering design review materials to our customers and executive team, as well as participate in proposal-writing efforts. As such, excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.

CesiumAstro is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
We provide a generous benefits and stock option package to all our employees.
Successful candidates will require, as a minimum:
• Bachelor of Science (BS) or Master of Science (MS) degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university.
Minimum of 4 years of industry or university research experience in power electronics design, analysis, test, and troubleshooting. More experienced candidates are also encouraged to apply.
Expert-level proficiency in electronics design (EDA) tools such as Altium.
Expert-level proficiency in PCB layout for power circuits.
Experience with SPICE-based circuit simulation.
Experience with power integrity simulation tools such as Ansys or ADS.
Extensive hands-on experience with lab instruments such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, electronic loads, and signal generators.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Preferred experience includes:
• Aerospace electronics design, development, and qualification.
Worst-case circuit analysis, failure method and criticality analyses, and reliability analysis.
EMI/EMC design and mitigation techniques.",CesiumAstro

Ensure effective coordination and support between account teams for pre/post-sale technical resources.

Working knowledge (hands-on preferred) and deep understanding of data networking infrastructures, architectures, concepts and associated technologies: Route/Switch L2/L3, TCP/IP, LAN/WAN, Routing Protocols (BGP/ISIS/OSPF, etc.), MPLS, LDP, L2/L3 VPN, Multicast, ACL, FW.
Working knowledge of DWDM/CWDM optical transport systems, switches, routers, modules, platforms in major network equipment such as Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Ciena, Nokia/ALU, etc.
Experience in DOCSIS CMTS, Edge QAM, Outside Plant/ HFC understanding, large venue Wi-Fi deployment, IP video, SDN/NFV is a plus.

d46b7d2d48082e39,2020-08-01 15:27:00 UTC,"Austin, TX",Support+Engineer,Austin,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Sr. Product Designer,"

Senior Product Designer - Location: Remote, US or Canada
Hi there!

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Partnerships Zone. This team collaborates and co-creates alongside the world's top SaaS companies to leverage the power of Zapier in new and meaningful ways to delight our mutual customers. This is a key strategic initiative at Zapier. This role will play a key part in solving new challenges that broaden our reach. Are you excited to work on challenging problems with a team of designers, product managers, and engineers? Then keep reading!

We know applying for and taking on a new job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited to apply at Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier, here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. We hope you'll take the leap of faith and apply.
<ul>
• Our Commitment to Applicants
• Culture and Values at Zapier
• Zapier Guide to Remote Work
• Zapier Code of Conduct
• Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier
Zapier is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.
About you

You are a skilled UX designer. You have at least 7 years experience designing and building software product experiences for end-users and have shipped design for a product used by millions of people.You have a strong user-centered approach when making design decisions, and you back that understanding with compelling design solutions. You're excited to face complex, technical problems and turn them into delightful moments for customers. You are able to quickly build up an understanding of all experiences and touch points that go into delivering value to our customers and you help your product teams with product roadmap planning and prioritization.

You know how to conduct research and leverage data. You enjoy learning from customers, and you're comfortable scheduling, participating, and facilitating time with them regularly to clarify or validate assumptions. You're experienced in multiple research methods. You communicate what you learn with your product team/squad, and work with them to prioritize and iterate on solutions. You know how to measure the results of your work, test it with real users, and understand its downstream effects.

You're a skilled written communicator. Zapier is a 100% remote team and writing is our primary means of communication. You'll use written summaries and reports to communicate design thinking, rationale, findings, and next steps to other designers, product managers, engineers, and the full Zapier team. You know how to tell a compelling story in a concise way.

You are self-directed and process driven. At Zapier, we believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves. You've had experience helping improve systems that lead to measurable outcomes.

You help others grow. You realize that there are learning opportunities for you when you teach others and help them grow. You invest time and attention to sharing what you've learned on your journey, and help guide and support others on theirs.
A Product Designer's Role at Zapier
Zapier is a small, fast-paced, and rapidly growing company, so you'll get experience with a little bit of everything. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:
<ul>
• Lead the creation of delightful user-centered experiences by adhering to established design patterns and helping to build upon and deliver improvements to existing patterns.
• Conduct user research and synthesize results and communicate findings to your product teams.
• Champion and teach others UX best practices to ensure we're all making informed design decisions together.
• Help drive towards the goals of your product teams and understand how the team's goals connect to the company goals and impact company metrics.
• Lead discussions on UX/UI problems, and present alternative solutions to problems based on your understanding of user needs and business needs.
• Request feedback from Design Team members, assigned product team members, and other teammates around Zapier through asynchronous or synchronous communication.
• Collaborate and share work early and often. Create clickable prototypes or provide links to assets with your teams for feedback and to conduct usability testing.
• Prioritize your design workload based on a clear understanding of the product team and company goals.
• Provide support to other Zapiens, spread knowledge, and develop the team outside of any formal reporting structures.
• Help to maintain the Zapier Design System and ensure our team is using it effectively.
• Deliver high quality, complete designs, and specifications for large, complex projects alongside PMs and engineers.
• Help to onboard other designers and welcome them to the team.
• Be a mentor to other Product Designers to help them level up their design skills.
About Zapier

For the past nine years, Zapier has been helping people across the world automate the boring and tedious parts of their job. We do that by helping everyone connect the web applications they already use and love.

We believe that there are jobs a computer is best at doing and that there are jobs a human is best at doing. We want to empower businesses to create processes and systems that let computers do what they are best at doing and let humans do what they are best at doing.
We believe that with the right tools, you can have a big impact with less hassle.
We believe in small teams. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management and more getting things done.
We believe in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment. All teammates at Zapier agree to a code of conduct.
The Whole Package
Location: United States or Canada

Our team of 350+ is distributed (remote) because it lets us work with the best people. We have team members that live in the United Kingdom, Thailand, India, Nigeria, Taiwan, Guatemala, New Zealand, Australia, and more! While we can hire many roles in locations anywhere in the world, some require specific timezone fits.
Compensation:
<ul>
• Competitive salary (we don't use remote as an excuse to pay less)
• Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage*
• Retirement plan with 4% company match*
• Profit-sharing
• 2 annual company retreats to awesome places
• 14 weeks paid leave for new parents of biological or adopted children
• Pick your own equipment. We'll set you up with whatever Apple laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.

• Unlimited vacation policy. Plus we require you to take at least 2 weeks off each year. We see most employees take 4-5 weeks off per year. This isn't a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation.
• Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with great software companies all over the world and you'll constantly get to interact with people from these great companies
• While we take care of our international folks as best we can, currently, healthcare and retirement plans are only available to UK, Canada, and US-based employees.
How To Apply

We have a non-standard application process. To jump-start the process we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out of the gate.

After you apply, you are going to hear back from us, even if we don't seem like a good fit. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to make sure you never go more than seven days without hearing from us.

Zapier is an equal opportunity employer. We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, color, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, or age. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.

",Zapier

Company Description

Living Security helps organizations protect their sensitive data by reducing their #1 cybersecurity risk, human error. WE BELIEVE in security for the sake of the person. Computers will always augment human judgment, not the other way around. WE CREATE intelligence-driven security learning content that trains users to identify and react to current and emerging threats. WE DELIVER a meaningful experience, grounded in behavioral science, that is easy to understand and hard to forget.

While we take our mission seriously, we have a lot of fun while executing! We believe our clients’ success equals our success and we think of ourselves as an extension of their team and align our goals with there’s. We're looking for someone who has a passion for our clients and a client-focused mindset for value-driven, strategic improvements to join our team.
Job Description

We are looking for a DevOps engineer with professional experience building CI/CD pipelines, a strong understanding of zero-downtime deployments, and is obsessed with monitoring deployed applications - and keeping them up.

You will work with (and should already have experience with) a range of technologies from Docker, Serverless, and bare EC2 instances. Terraform is a plus and you must feel comfortable working with configuration-as-code in general. Your primary objective is to help developers deploy quicker, but more importantly - with stability.
Automation should be your number one tool. You will help developers, customer support, and other stakeholders meet their needs through tooling - that you build.
Our customers are large enterprises. The ideal candidate will have prior knowledge of working in an enterprise environment, but be able to balance the needs of our company as a startup.
Qualifications

• 2+ years experience in a professional DevOps role
  • AWS Certification(s)
  • Demonstrable experience with Terraform or CloudFormation
  • Python
  • SQL
  • Serverless Experience
Additional Information
Responsible PTO policy
Flex-time
Paid Holidays
Health Insurance
Job Type: Full-time
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Salary commensurate with experience

<div>

TradeRev is an online automotive remarketing system where dealers can launch and participate in real-time vehicle auctions at any time from their mobile devices or desktop. It allows Sellers to obtain instant bids while the retail customer is sitting in the showroom by providing a private, customized network for Buyers and Sellers that quickly and efficiently move fresh trades.

We believe when it comes to buying a car, everyone should come out a winner. That’s why we’ve created the world’s first transparent automotive exchange, where every transaction plays out in the open for all to see and where both buyers and sellers are equally set up to win. Because we believe, people should trust the automotive purchase process, and get excited about it.

Title
Senior Software QA Engineer

Position
Senior Software QA Engineer

Full-Time/Part-Time
Full-Time

Location
US - Headquarters Based in Austin Texas
Description
Job Purpose:
To perform automated tests on L7 Informatics' software product Enterprise Science Platform (ESP) to ensure it meets customer and quality requirements.
Hiring Locations: Austin Texas and Raleigh North Carolina
Responsibilities:
• Responsible for complete end-to-end validation and verification of L7 ESP.
• Perform software validation analysis, define and document test plans and specifications required for regulatory compliance.
• Participate in designing, building, and maintaining test automation frameworks to continuously improve test coverage.
• Perform debugging and root cause analysis of product issues or defects.
• Work closely with developers to build quality into our development process.
• Perform diagnosis, documentation, and aid in remediation of identified quality concerns.
• Participate in the creation and maintenance of automated and manual software quality assurance systems, processes, and documentation.
• Identify, record, document, and track bugs in JIRA.
Position Requirements
Education, Experience, and Skills Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related subject.
• Two (2) + years of relevant experience in software quality assurance and/or software development.
• Experience using agile/scrum process to develop software.
• Experience with common software development infrastructure and tooling (e.g., AWS, Jenkins, git, etc.).
• Experience with Python and Javascript
• Familiarity of automated tools such as Cypress
• Knowledgeable of software quality assurance methodologies, tools, and processes.
• Ability to write clear, concise, and comprehensive English-language test cases.
• Ability to learn complex technical application systems.
• Ability to thrive in fast-paced, deadline-driven internal and customer-facing environment.
• Ability to work quickly while maintaining strong attention to detail and accuracy.
• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
• Strong communication and organizational skills.
Nice to Have Skills:
• Background in biological sciences.
• Familiarity with laboratory processes.

EOE Statement
We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This position is currently accepting applications.

Who We Are:

SAM Companies is recognized as the industry’s technology leader in providing geospatial solutions and construction phase services on a national scale. Our staff encompasses 1,000+ individuals from diverse backgrounds who are deploying the latest industry technology and changing the way data is collected and delivered in our industry.
Our Culture

Our entrepreneurial culture is a key factor in SAM being recognized as a Top Workplace for seven consecutive years, and we make it our mission to ensure every one of our employees learns how to build and manage a business, not just be the subject matter expert on the team. At SAM, our employee’s development is instrumental to our success. Your learning will be supported by specialized in-house training programs and mentoring by the industry’s leading experts, who just happen to be on our staff! We make SAM a GREAT place to work, but it all starts with YOU!
Your Impact at SAM:<div>
As a UAS Pilot, you will work as part of a flight crew in the field to carry out missions and successfully acquire data for survey and inspection projects.
• Under the review and direction of the Flight Operations Manager, perform aerial data collection using Unmanned Aerial Vehicles
Act as the Pilot in Command while flying unmanned aerial projects
Conduct pre-flight mission planning and coordination, including filing NOTAMS, submitting COA requests, and conducting pre-flight and on site risk
Perform preventative maintenance on sensor equipment and unmanned aerial vehicles
Conduct field data checks following data collection to ensure adequate project coverage
Perform other tasks as assigned to help accomplish the Company’s strategic goals
What You Bring to SAM:<ul><li>
Good communication (oral and written) and organizational skills are essential
A passion for troubleshooting problems in the field
Candidate should demonstrate previous experience with UAVs, and an ability to quickly become proficient in the use of such technology
Ability to operate independent of daily direction and overcome obstacles encountered during field work
FAA issued Part 107 Remote Pilot Airman’s Certificate required. No minimum flight hour experience
Our Perks!

We offer a best-in-class benefits package that includes company paid premiums for medical, vision, dental and life insurance. SAM’s 401 (k) program offers a 100% employer match up to 3% of your contribution, along with a 401(k) profit sharing and performance-based bonuses. In addition, we offer:
Generous paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
No glass ceiling! Truly a place to spread your wings
• Work/life balance with flexible work hours – priority is getting the job done
• Trainings every Tuesday – Specialized in-house trainings programs designed to assist you in advancing in your career
• Office snacks, free food and fun-themed, employee events provided throughout the year
• Passion for our Community – You have endless opportunities to volunteer alongside your peers with our Corporate Social Responsibility Program
EEO

SAM is an EOE/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V. If you are interested in applying for employment and need special assistance to apply for a posted position, please send an e-mail to careers@sam.biz. SAM also participates in the federal E-Verify Program.

","SAM, LLC"

Description
<div>

Thank you for your interest in employment with the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles (TxDMV). To apply for this position, complete an on-line application either through the TxDMV CAPPS External Applicant Career Section at https://capps.taleo.net/careersection/ex/jobsearch.ftl?lang=en or through Work In Texas (WIT) at http://www.twc.state.tx.us/.

For job opening inquiries or to request a reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act please contact the TxDMV Human Resources Division by calling 512-465-4043. Applications must be received by the closing date in order to be considered for this posting. TxDMV does not accept paper applications.

Veterans: The following two websites provide useful information and other job opportunities. Military to Civilian Occupation Translator http://www.careerinfonet.org/moc/ and the Texas Veterans Commission https://www.tvc.texas.gov/employment/veterans/
If requested, reasonable accommodations will be made for persons with disabilities for any part of the employment process in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.
GENERAL DESCRIPTION

<div>Performs advanced professional assistance in the Vehicle Title and Registration Division (VTR) at the Texas Department of Motor Vehicles (TxDMV). Work involves organizing administrative operations for the division including greeting customers, receiving incoming calls, establishing and managing administrative procedures, scheduling of meetings, making travel arrangements and processing travel reimbursements for division staff. Develops correspondence and memos, reports, and prepares materials for meetings. Establishes and maintains filing systems, manages division records, records retention schedule, and responds to requests for public information. Serves as the web content liaison for the division. Works under limited supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. The salary range on this job posting reflects the minimum and maximum allowed by the state classification salary schedules
column2: however, budget considerations may result in salary offers below the maximum of the posted range.

column1: ESSENTIAL DUTIES

1. Supports the Vehicle Title and Registration Division Director and staff. Maintains calendars, schedules meetings, secures meeting space, develops agendas, prepares meeting information, drafts and distributes meeting notes, and tracks action items.

2. Develops administrative procedures including correspondence and reports protocols, document tracking, records management, meeting request formats and protocols, and ensures confidential information and documents are maintained accordingly.
3. Assists the division director with managing daily activities and projects to ensure deadlines are met. May respond to emails on behalf of the division director.
4. Recommends records retention schedule for division documents. Manages approved records retention schedule and coordinates responses to open records requests.

5. Makes travel arrangements for the director, develops travel itinerary, and coordinates with financial services on reimbursement. Assists division staff with travel requests, arrangements and reimbursement process. Ensures accuracy of submitted travel documents. Reviews and ensures accuracy of vehicle leases and expenditures associated with state owned vehicles.
6. Ensures appropriate customer service is provided. Greets customers, receives incoming calls and routes calls to appropriate agency staff. Processes incoming and outgoing mail.

7. Reviews and edits correspondence for clarity and routes appropriately. Develops and maintains a document tracking and filing system, tracks assignments and action items. Tracks and monitors assignments and ensures deadlines are met.
8. Responsible for maintaining stakeholder contact list and ensuring messages regarding changes in policy, procedures and agency activities are delivered.
9. Develops a list of mandatory reporting requirements, coordinates with appropriate staff and ensures reporting deadlines are met.

10. Coordinates with division managers and staff on development of meeting materials, proof reads materials and suggests improvements, ensures timelines are met, and follows up on assignments with staff.
11. Coordinates asset inventory for the division and ensures property transfer documentation is maintained.
12. Monitors legislative information, coordinates bill analysis submission and reporting for the division director.
13. Serves as the division’s website content manager. Ensures website content is up-to-date and posted on the agency’s intranet and internet websites.
14. Manages special projects as assigned, develops timelines, reports status, identifies risks and issues, and escalates issues as needed.
15. Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
COMPETENCIES
Dealing with ambiguity – Can effectively cope with change

Who We Want

If you’ve been on the job hunt for the past few months you may have seen our name a lot and wondered, “why are they still hiring?” The quick answer is we are growing like crazy! Our order volume has tripled since March and we expect those trends to continue as more and more people shift to online shopping. We’re looking for more great people to help us meet that demand and get the work done every day.
<div>

We’ve built our organization from the ground up through constant trial-and-error, bright ideas from the folks doing the work and radically candid feedback. Do you find that you not only enjoy your job more but perform better when you’re surrounded by awesome people everyday? If we are speaking your language, please apply so we can get to know you more!
<div>

Team members who have been successful at Sauceda give a shit about the work they do every single day. They aren't afraid to speak up or ask questions. They eagerly jump in to help fellow team members who could use an extra hand, and most importantly, they understand the impact that a positive attitude can have on getting our work done every day.
<div>

People who haven't thrived at Sauceda tend to prefer teams and roles with a lot of structure to them, and they enjoy spending energy refining existing process rather than exploring or building new ones. Traditional warehouse workers haven't always faired well with us because we're not a traditional warehouse company.
<div><b>
What You'll Be Doing

We're the magic behind the online shopping experience. Day-to-day tasks can include picking and packing product from our warehouse shelves, or prepping and kitting special projects. We look for people who are eager to help any team within our operations group that might need it most on any given day, be that inbound, outbound, inventory management, returns, or wholesale.
For This Job You Must
Have a great attitude about life and work
Learn quickly
• Be physically able to be on your feet most of the day and lift 50lbs
Be comfortable working in a non-temperature controlled warehouse
Be unafraid to ask questions
Have a desire to be a part of a good team and community
These Are Nice Not Necessary
Service industry experience
Traditional retail experience
E-commerce experience
Important Details
Hours per week: 40 hours

Schedule: Our teams work a 5-day work week with 2 consecutive days off. Workday hours are 8am-5pm. On really busy days team members may be asked to come in early or stay late. Anything over 40 hours is of course paid at the overtime rate.
Compensation: $13.00 - $14.00 per hour
Perks
Benefits: Medical, dental, vision &
column2: supplemental

column1: Paid Time Off: 8 days + major holidays
Emergency Sick Leave: 10 days for COVID19 or COVID19 related issue
Paid Parental Leave: moms get 12 weeks/dads and adoptive parents get 4 weeks
Discounts: on Texas Humor and other fulfillment client merchandise
• Cash Out: access earned wages before payday up to twice a month as needed
Treats: Free beer and snacks in the office
How We're Handling COVID19
<div>

We'd like to take a moment to address the elephant in the room - AKA COVID19. You may be sitting here asking yourself, ""Am I putting myself at risk by applying for this job?"" ""How do I know if this company is operating safely within this unprecedented pandemic?""
<div>
These questions, and others like it, are important and fair ones to be asking yourself right now.
While we can't promise a situation that is completely risk-free, we can say this.

The COVID19 situation is constantly evolving, therefore, so too are our actions. We’re doing our absolute best to act on new information without compromising the health and safety of our people, the viability of our company, or the trust of our employees for us to make the right call as the situation continues to develop. We encourage you to read more about our plan of action for getting through this challenging time together here.
",Sauceda Industries
