Biomedical engineering (BME) is the application of engineering principles and design concepts to medicine and biology for healthcare purposes (e.g. diagnostic or therapeutic).
Biomedical engineers design instruments, devices, and software used in healthcare
column2: bring together knowledge from many technical sources to develop new procedures
column3:
or conduct research needed to solve clinical problems.
Using SAS on Biomedical domain engineers Biomedical engineers work closely with life scientists, chemists and medical professionals (physicians, therapists and technicians) on the engineering aspects of using SAS technology are as :
 Design and develop medical devices such as artificial hearts and kidneys, pacemakers, artificial hips, surgical lasers, automated patient monitors and blood chemistry sensors.
 Adapt computer hardware or software for medical science or health care applications (for example, develop expert systems that assist in diagnosing diseases, medical imaging systems, models of different aspects of human physiology or medical data management)
 Develop and evaluate quantitative models of biological processes and systems.
 Apply engineering methods to answer basic questions about how the body works.
 Develop models or computer simulations of human bio-behavioral systems in order to obtain data for measuring or controlling life processes.

Are you a strong software engineer who wants to make a difference during the Covid-19 pandemic?
We are a small, lively team of software engineers committed to agile development practices. Our pipeline produces and delivers thousands Covid-19 test results and reports every day, 24/7.
We are continuing to push the scale of our system as the demand for testing across the country increases, and need help to reach that next level.

We are seeking a talented and motivated software engineer to join our energetic team to chart this new course in virology testing. We are a core part of the Broad Institute, a deeply-collaborative scientific institution that is transforming medicine and human health by building software solutions to process and analyze scientific data on an unprecedented scale. No medical, genomics, or scientific background is required, just an enthusiasm to improve the world of medicine and an ability to write exceptional software.

• Work with team, product owners and users to understand and define requirements
• Perform comprehensive unit, integration and scale testing of all software produced

• Enjoy solving complicated algorithmic and scalability problems
• Understand good software development practices
• Design and build new software tools and systems on the cloud
• Provide rotating operational support for our 24/7 COVID related products, along with the rest of the team
• Have a strong desire to learn about viral genomics and the broader scientific work of the Broad Institute
Characteristic Duties
Our ideal candidate will work closely within a close-knit, friendly team and will
• Enjoy working in a collaborative setting with existing team members
• Be able to work independently and know when to ask for help

• Thrives in an energetic and fast paced environment
Desired Skills
• Experience with Python or similar programming language
• Experience with Google Cloud Platform (or another cloud platform like AWS or Azure)
• Experience with relational databases, PostgreSQL preferred
• Experience writing unit tests and integration tests
• Experience working in a production environment
• Comfortable with github, shell scripting, and CI/CD workflows
• Comfortable working with a remote team until in-person work is possible again
• No medical, genomics, or scientific background is required, just an enthusiasm to improve the world of medicine and an ability to write exceptional software.
Qualifications

Introduction

Do you have a passion for robotics? Do you want to code the future of one of the largest consumer robot company in the world? You will have a hand in developing the next generation of products that will live in millions of homes all across the world. As a pioneer in the robot industry, our goal is to drive innovation, serve as an industry catalyst and change the world by empowering people to do more.

Our Software Engineering Team is rapidly growing and we're looking for an exceptional Senior Robotics Software Engineer - Strategy to join our team. We're looking for someone with great interpersonal skills, passion, energy, and the desire to build.
What You Will Do
• Design and implement software for robotic systems focused on high level robotic behaviors
• Solve problems pragmatically, applying judgment and experience to balance trade-offs
• Lead investigations in understanding how our robots perform in their environments to drive improvements to the robot's success.
• Deliver artifacts that set the standard in your group for engineering excellence, from designs to implementations
Desired Qualifications:
• Solid understanding and experience in design patterns, data structures and advanced programming techniques
• Excellence at writing embedded C/C++ and familiarity with a Linux Environment
• Strong understanding of computer systems including concurrent programming and operating systems
• Familiarity with motion control, sensor processing, path planning, or local space perception
• Passion for robotics and experience building or programming robots professionally or as a hobby
• M.S. or B.S. in Computer Engineering or equivalent degree
• Understanding of or experience with any of the following:
<ul><li>Behavior-based robotics
• Navigation, path planning, obstacle avoidance
• SLAM, estimation and control
Preferred Qualifications:
• Understanding of and experience with the following: ROS/ROS2, Gazeebo for simulation-based development and test.
• Understanding of and experience with any of the following: object recognition, structure from motion, 3D reconstruction, ego-motion estimation, feature extraction and matching face recognition.

• Algorithm prototyping/development with MATLAB and/or Python.

8bb80d9ec3aa1355,2020-08-01 23:20:00 UTC,"Cambridge, MA",senior+developer,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Senior Software Engineer,"

The Company

Dyno Therapeutics is reshaping the gene therapy landscape through AI-powered vectors. Through the application of our transformative technologies and strategic partnerships with leaders in gene therapy, we believe a future with life changing gene therapies for millions of people is within reach.
Our team includes world-class molecular and synthetic biologists, protein engineers and gene therapy scientists working alongside software engineers, data scientists, and machine learning experts.
The Role

Senior Software Engineer - Data Team. The data science team is at the heart of Dyno's platform, and your work as a part of this team can have a major impact on the future of gene therapy. Our team's responsibilities span from analyzing biological data in a statistically rigorous manner to building machine learning models, developing computational optimization approaches, and contributing to experimental design of high-throughput viral libraries.
How You Will Contribute

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will take a leading role in the design and architecture of our end-to-end data pipeline, create strong software quality standards, and collaborate closely with data scientists to streamline the process of running machine learning models on our data effectively.
Responsibilities:
<ul>
• Lead our tech stack decision making, implementing the newest and best suited tools for large, data driven, machine learning workflows.
• Build deployment architectures which are stable, reliable and performant.
• Optimize tracking, storage and serving of biological data.
• Develop and maintain software best practices, including continuous integration, agile and test driven design.
• Interface with biologists and data scientists to understand opportunities to meet their needs with software.
Who you are
<ul>
• Trusted partner
• Team oriented
<li>Thoughtful &amp
column2: detail oriented

column1: • Work with a sense of urgency
• Appreciation for opportunities at the intersections of data science and biology
Basic qualifications
<ul>
• BS, MS, or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline or equivalent experience.
• Expertise in Python and SQL.
• Experience with cloud-based platforms (AWS preferred).
• One year of software engineering experience in industry.
• Experience designing or maintaining complex software platforms.
• Experience deploying production systems in the cloud.
Preferred qualifications
<ul>
• Fluency with software life-cycle best practices and devops.
• 2+ years of industry experience in software development, including database designs, and distributed computing and data pipelines.
• Proficiency with common data infrastructure tools (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, PostgreSQL, Sqlachemy).
• Familiarity with machine learning in a production setting.
• Work experience at a leading software company or early responsibility in software-driven startups.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Type: Full-time

",Dyno Therapeutics

Job Description
Our Mission: ""Helping People Hear Better""

About Lucid: Lucid Hearing is a leading innovator in the field of assistive listening and hearing solutions, and it has established itself as a premier manufacturer and retailer of hearing solutions with its state-of-the-art hearing aids, testing equipment, and a vast network of locations within large retail chains. As a fast-growing business in an expanding industry, Lucid Hearing is constantly searching for passionate people to add to our family of associates.

Ideal Candidate: Lucid Hearing desires candidates who are motivated, ambitious and want to be a part of an industry-disrupting sales model. Candidates should be licensed hearing aid dispensers and/or dispensing audiologists. A passion for helping the hearing-impaired is a must-have. For those interested in a career path, we at Lucid Hearing strive to promote from within, with two-thirds of our Operations Leadership team promoted internally.

Continued on the job training (virtual courses)

Recommend and dispense assistive listening and hearing solutions
Educate patients in how to use and maintain the hearing aid devices, provide demonstrations and information
Make follow-up calls to patients to ensure satisfaction with their assistive listening and hearing device

Licensed Hearing Aid Dispenser and / or an Audiologist
Motivated by helping people hear better
Ambitious with a sales attitude
An entrepreneur mindset with problem-solving skills, this role will have great autonomy
Excellent follow-up skills

Test 2-4 people per day on average
Average weekly sales of $8,800

The Retail Sales Representative (RSR) is responsible for developing and growing sales volume in their assigned territory through effective fact-based selling and relationship building with retail account’s operations personnel at store and market (district) level.

ef47be2fb1fae90d,2020-08-01 15:24:00 UTC,"Boston, MA",People+Operations,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,"Sr. Director, Head of Portfolio Management and Strategy Execution","
As a core member of the Lung Cancer Initiative (LCI) Leadership Team (LT), the Sr. Director, Head of Portfolio Management and Strategy Execution will serve as a key partner to the LCI LT to provide Portfolio Management and Strategy Execution leadership across the entire LCI. Close collaboration with the Head, Cross-Sector Programs, Pillar leads and the Global Head of the LCI will be key for success. Primary responsibilities for this position include leading portfolio management and execution of the short- and long-term LCI strategy as part of the LCI Strategy Execution Office (SEO), a team focused on ensuring the LCI strategy is efficiently and effectively executed. Through close partnership and problem solving with SEO leaders from scientific strategy, commercial strategy, program management, HR, legal, finance, operations, as well as with Pillar leaders and Program directly-responsible individuals (DRIs), the Sr. Director, Head of Portfolio Management and Strategy Execution will lead a strong focus on execution of the LCI strategy. This includes leadership of program management, project management and operations leaders through a center of excellence (CoE) that will influence and lead portfolio/program/project management across the LCI. A cross-sector mindset will also be needed in order to assess, interpret and utilize portfolio management practices across different types of pipelines, assets, development stages, etc.

The Sr. Director, Head of Portfolio Management and Strategy Execution will also lead the connection to LCI and WWDA Operations teams to ensure 1) effective cross-LCI and WWDA partnership on business operations (LRFP, budgets, contracts, purchase orders and milestone payments in collaboration with Finance, HCC and procurement), 2) operational excellence with the operations team (regulated and non-regulated process in collaboration with QA, RA and Compliance organizations, measures and management reporting). A close partnership with LCI Pillar Leaders, Program DRIs and Clinical Leadership will also be a focus for this role. This individual will also take part in leading periodic business transformation activities in LCI as needed. In order to ensure strong LCI execution, close partnership outside of LCI and WWDA will also be required with GEI and other J&
column2: J PMO functions, serving as a liaison to sectors to facilitate cross sector collaborations and project/program alignment and to ensure compliant and effective LCI processes. These efforts are for both internal as well as external initiatives. Also important for this role is the ability to develop and implement a lean, nimble operating model by both challenging current internal processes and developing efficient new processes.

column1: Lead portfolio management oversight and execution of the short- and long-term LCI strategy as part of the LCI Strategy Execution Office (SEO). Develop robust portfolio management processes, metrics, &
column2: tools (in close collaboration with Pillar leads &amp
column3: Finance). Establish strategic imperatives to drive portfolio trade-offs and execution alignment. Pipeline evaluation and monitoring as an element of portfolio management. Serve as a key contributor to Strat Plan, Business Plan and LRFP for LCI. Ensure alignment of strategy, portfolio &amp
column4: execution and measure progress. Assess new program opportunities, with ability to succinctly capture value, risk, and recommendations for participation. Create frameworks that enable rigorous and objective decision-making within and across pillars to drive prioritization and trade-offs. For over 35 years, the Charitable Asset Management team has been a leading provider of asset management, administration, and tax services for charitable organizations. We oversee $3 billion of charitable assets for over 200 nonprofit clients. Our work enables charitable planned giving programs to thrive while providing their donors a way to support a mission, receive an income, and ensure a philanthropic legacy. Our specialized group at SSGA provides all of the resources necessary for a nonprofit to build and grow a successful planned gift program. This position provides a rare opportunity to join a niche investment and administrative unit within State Street Global Advisors.
Responsibilities:

You will work directly and independently with a book of nonprofit clients, their planned giving programs, and their financial teams while coordinating the onboarding of new gifts, administration of existing gifts, termination of mature gifts, and ongoing reporting.
• Participate in face-to-face meetings with client fundraising offices, finance offices, and investment committees
column2: prepare and deliver monthly, quarterly, annual and ad-hoc client reporting

column1: • Partner with our dedicated tax team, investment management team, and operations team to provide outstanding client service

• Build enthusiastic, positive relationships with colleagues and clients
• Gain a keen understanding of the clients' missions and their challenges
• Resolve client issues independently, field questions and respond to concerns from their donors and beneficiaries
• Familiarize yourself and help implement SSGA’s corporate procedures, including AML/KYC and other compliance requirements

• College degree and/or advanced training
• 1 to 3 years of experience in non-profit organizations, with a strong preference for the planned giving field
• Excellent attention to detail and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced work environment
• Knowledge of charitable trusts, charitable gift annuities, and pooled income funds is a plus
• Prior fundraising experience not required, but recommended
• Excellent interpersonal skills, strong social and team skills
• Strong computer, accounting, and service skills
• Some travel required, 20%
About us

Around the world, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and dedicated, engaged employees are critical to our continued success.

Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential is important to us. It’s also part of our dedication to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.

Office Manager - Tremont School

Concord, MA – Hourly Position

Tremont School embraces our students’ individuality, empowering them to be critical thinkers and compassionate citizens.

JOB SUMMARY:

Under the supervision of the Executive Director, the Office Manager organizes, directs and performs varied and complex clerical and secretarial work with confidentiality and sensitivity. In performing duties, responsibilities, and tasks, the individual utilizes independent judgment, initiative, tact, patience and kindness. The Office Manager is often the first voice and face representing the school and its vision, mission, and core values.

CHARACTERISTICS:

The School Office Manager provides a professional environment that supports and welcomes people to the school. The position is characterized by wide-ranging responsibilities often conducted in an atmosphere of frequent interruptions, time constraints and/or in the necessary absences of the

Tremont Administrator(s). This position is pivotal in facilitating the school's educational purposes and the efficient daily operations of the school office. The position buffers the Tremont Administrator(s) and staff from unnecessary interruptions.

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES:

The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to this classification.

column13: • Maintain and update student and staff emergency information, i.e. emergency cards, computer data and disaster preparedness
column14: • Maintain student attendance records, including preparation and verification of daily student attendance, entering enrollment information into the attendance system, preparing required attendance reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis
column15:
• Maintain employee time reports and attendance records
  • Prepare transportation requests, calendars and answers questions about field trip activities
column16: • Maintain information on and answer questions regarding specific school programs, fundraisers and after school activities
column17: • Compose school-wide communications, correspondence, and a variety of bulletins, newsletters, memos, emails, forms and update the school calendars
column18:
• Maintain control of school facility keys, assign and distribute keys to staff as necessary.

Other Related Duties

  • Assist with implementation and coordination of emergency procedures for Tremont Disaster Plan
column19:

  • Assist with student medical needs and administer first aid, CPR and/or prescribed medication as necessary

b4eacb1a647605ed,2020-08-01 23:24:00 UTC,"Boston, MA 02115 (Mission Hill area)",People+Operations,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,"Senior Administrator, Cardiothoracic Service Line, BWH Clinical Services","

Senior Administrator, Cardiothoracic Service Line, BWH Clinical Services
<div><b>
General Summary:

Brigham Health has made a strategic decision to develop and operate service lines as a structural overlay to academic departments. A service line – or set of service lines – will be coordinated by a Senior Administrator who will support service integration, enhanced patient experience, cross-site clinical business development, and value-based care delivery.

This position is accountable for the overall integration and development of a designated service line or set of service lines. The Senior Administrator is a member of the service line’s administrative leadership team, and is responsible for working with the SVP of Clinical Services and Department Chair(s) (collectively the service line leaders), the Department Administrator(s), and other department leadership in the strategic planning process, service line development activities (including center development and implementation), and coordination of the various departments and divisions in order to create effective delivery of multidisciplinary care, high quality and superb patient experience, and clinical growth. He/she is the primary administrative resource for service line coordination, program and project development (analysis, planning, and evaluation), and program review (assessment, performance improvement, and support).

BH utilizes a co-reporting structure to ensure success of the Senior Administrator. The Senior Administrator will report directly to and receive day-to-day content guidance from the SVP. The Senior Administrator will also be expected to work in service of the applicable departments and, as such, work at the guidance of the applicable Department Administrators as directed by the SVP. This position reports indirectly to the VP of Analytics, Planning, Strategy and Improvement (APSI) as a part of a central team of service line administrators. Partnership lines will also be established with the BWPO – through which the Senior Administrator can access data and guidance.
<div><div><b>
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
1. Serves as critical member of the service line’s administrative leadership team.

2. At the direction of the service line leaders, advances the overall vision, direction, goals, and objectives of the service line. Coordinates the service line’s strategic planning process, advances activities and initiatives to achieve long range goals set by service line leaders and ensures the implementation of strategic business plans that are aligned with the service line’s vision, strategic plans, and goals.

3. Identifies, evaluates, and advances the design of service line centers of care, consistent with the strategic business plans and the growth and market objectives of the service line. Works with departmental and hospital leadership and the APSI department to prepare the necessary business plans and documentation. Manages the implementation.

4. Leads the service line and associated center(s) development and supports functional operations, working closely with department and division leadership. Serves as a central coordinating force for service line activities.
5. Ensures healthy and collaborative administrative relationships within the service line, amongst departments and divisions, the hospital, the continuum of care, and Partners HealthCare System.
6. Monitors and reports on the status of how service line practices align with goals established by service line leadership.

7. Supports the service line center(s) development and ensures that the disciplines are working in a clinically integrated fashion as designed, working closely and at the guidance of department and division leadership.
8. Establishes and maintains clear and precise communications with all key stakeholders of the service line. Communicates openly and collaboratively with other administrators and hospital leaders.
9. Continuously assesses and improves the efficiency of systems and processes.
Financial Management

1. Establishes effective systems to analyze and report on financial flows and ensure holistic and multidisciplinary fiscal management, in coordination with the Department Administrators and under the direction of service line leadership.
2. Generates shadow operating statements that aggregate reporting of decentralized departmental resources.
3. Develops cross-service business plans and tracks/measures upstream and downstream services to properly portray ROI.
4. Understands and meets all service line financial reporting requirements in the prescribed format (per APSI and BWPO), under the direction of service line leadership.
5. Works in coordination with the Department Administrators and under the direction of the service line leadership to ensure cross-departmental and cross-hospital coordination of budgets
column2: presents and justifies budget requests to service line leadership as appropriate.

column1: 6. Examines, analyzes and interprets financial reports associated with the service line for the purpose of giving advice, preparing statements and projections, and ultimately, co-managing the appropriate utilization of resources, under the direction of service line leadership. Makes recommendations for value improvement through resource use or cost savings based on a thorough understanding of the service line and center(s).

7. Establishes and maintains a financial management system in collaboration with APSI and BWPO resources to allow accurate, detailed and up-to-the minute reporting of financial status and staffing distribution of all service line areas of importance.
8. Performs financial analyses per the direction of the service line leaders.
Center Management
1. Maintains an in-depth knowledge of the changing health care environment.

2. Works within APSI and with the BWPO, and Strategic Communications to assess the market’s need for clinical services. Monitors and evaluates the adequacy of the service line’s planned and existing services and ensures the development of programs and services to respond to the market.

3. In alignment with the department(s), develops, supports, and manages programmatic initiatives for care model development, care delivery improvement, cost reduction, and network and business development.

4. Under the leadership of the service line, reviews the ongoing management of the centers’ multidisciplinary clinical “products”, discusses and resolves any cross-service administrative problems that arise, and directs the planning of improvements in existing multidisciplinary clinical services.

5. Maintains a thorough understanding of clinical reimbursement and managed care issues specific to the center(s). Identifies opportunities to optimize clinical reimbursement and works with departmental leadership to execute change.
6. Supports the service line’s departments’ in advancement of the center’s quality and service experience goals.
Other Administrative Responsibilities
1. Consistently meets all deadlines for deliverables or activities as established by service line leadership – and thus departmental and hospital leadership.
2. Serves on service line, center, departmental and/or hospital committees as assigned.
3. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
<div><ul>
• Bachelor degree in a related field required. MBA or equivalent degree strongly preferred.
• 5-7 years administrative/management experience required.
• Academic medical center experience required.
Skills / Abilities / Competencies Required:

• Outstanding interpersonal relationship skills needed to motivate others and work with a wide range of people including many hospital-wide department heads, administrators, and physicians in a positive and collegial fashion.
• Ability to handle sensitive issues.

• Outstanding organizational skills are necessary to manage many competing timetables and responsibilities. Ability to delegate and effectively supervise and plan for the timely and successful completion of short- and long-term objectives.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with a large and diverse constituency, including senior hospital leaders, departmental faculty and support staff, representatives of other BWH offices, collaborating institution officials, and vendors.
• Requires the ability to work independently and to accept responsibility for complex and sensitive decision-making as it relates to the overall conduct of the service line.
• High degree of analytic ability.
• Excellent negotiation skills in complex and often sensitive multi-institutional negotiations for agreements and contracts.
• Ability to work independently and accurately and concisely disseminate information in both written and verbal formats.
EEO Statement

Brigham and Women’s Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability unrelated to job requirements, genetic information, military service, or other protected status.

The Associate Director, DSPV Operations provides leadership through independently managing the operational activities both internally and through a third-party Pharmacovigilance contract vendor related to the processing of adverse events from clinical trials and Postmarketing surveillance and ensures that performed tasks comply with DSPV SOPs and procedures, best industry standards and applicable regulations.

About us
National Grid is hiring a Lead Project Manager, for our Electric Capital Delivery project department in Waltham, MA.

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.

To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.
Job Purpose

Responsible for the delivery, management and governance of the Electric Capital Projects to ensure they are developed in a least cost, fit for purpose manner to most efficiently support the growing needs of the rapidly changing energy sector. Manage a portfolio of projects across transmission, substation, and distribution lines of business with multiple cross functional teams. Engage key stakeholders to ensure adherence to the Capital Delivery process, highest standards of health, safety, environmental, security and quality.
Key Accountabilities
Responsible for overall project performance as well as managing scope, schedule, budget, and safety performance.
Ensure NE Electric project forecasts, schedule, and scope are managed, including the development of recovery plans, to stay within approved delegation of authority (DoA) limits.
Interface directly with customers and stakeholders to report progress, costs, schedule, and risks across a portfolio of substation, transmission and distribution projects.
Review project reports and performance metrics to monitor progress according to plan, guide the resolution of any major issues and provide timely updates.
Schedule development including task successors, predecessors, critical path, and leads/lags and ability to apply appropriate logic to project schedules buildouts.
Manage project cash flows to communicate monthly forecasted spend to the business.

Facilitate and encourage the introduction of new technologies and innovative solutions to improve the delivery of Electric capital projects safely, on time, and in accordance with regulations, policies and procedures.
Support project developer and team through project planning &amp
column2: development stage working toward successful gate approval for the transition to actively managing all components of the detailed design, execution, and closeout phases of the Capital Delivery process

Demonstrate a high level of personal initiative, integrity and ability to interact with company personnel, contractors, regulatory representatives, and town/city officials in a positive collaborative manner.

written communication, critical analysis and capable of leading and influencing teams, and gaining support and commitment from a wider operational group.

Company Overview

Lyniate is the new home of Corepoint and Rhapsody, two industry-leading Software Interoperability Platforms that enhance healthcare ecosystems through seamless connectivity to unlock the potential of data, on-premises and in the cloud. Joining forces as a single company, Lyniate, we will raise the bar in healthcare interoperability, deliver cutting-edge solutions to address global interoperability challenges, and offer customers continued value from both the Rhapsody and Corepoint products they love. To learn more about Lyniate, visit www.lyniate.com.

Lyniate is experiencing significant growth all over the world. To build on our success and growth, we are actively seeking a forward-thinking, hands-on Revenue Manager to lead our growing team located in either our Boston, MA or Frisco, TX office. The right individual for this role is a proven Revenue Operations leader with a passion for operational excellence, great attention to detail, and a proven ability to work successfully as a team player.
Position Summary

The successful candidate will be involved with all aspects of the revenue process including interacting with sales, account management, licensing, and clients. Direct responsibilities include delivering high quality invoicing, collections, and customer support services to the business as well as being a business advisor on revenue recognition, contracts terms, and pricing strategies optimizing our NetSuite and Salesforce platforms. They will leverage their prior experiences and support their team to identify workflow issues and communicate/escalate root cause issues to appropriate parties with proposed solutions. In addition, this role will lead the monthly close process for the revenue function including necessary analysis and forecasting.
Responsibilities:
• Manage the day to day operations of the revenue process including leading a global team of 3 employees responsible for the invoicing and collections function
• Develop processes and solutions to accelerate customer payments and decrease DSO
• Review revenue/licensing contracts to ensure customer invoicing requirements are processed
• Provide ongoing guidance to the business on pricing, terms, revenue recognition and other areas
• Build and maintain relationships with sales, legal, finance business partners, and shared services personnel
• Develop and present monthly KPI’s for the revenue function
• Streamline and improve existing finance systems and processes to enable the business and finance function to scale
• Perform and review monthly account analyses and reconciliations, including validating deferred revenue, accounts receivable and revenue financial statement balances
• Partner with sales, sales operations, marketing, legal, and finance to execute daily operations
• Design and implement best practices in month end close procedures and documentation
• Continuously enhance and refine revenue close process and procedures that can scale effectively as we grow, implementation functional owner in ad hoc revenue accounting projects
Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics
• 7+ years of revenue operations experience in the software or similar industry
• Hands-on contract review and technical revenue accounting experience with on-premise software, SAAS, and professional services
• Strong excel and PowerPoint skills
• Experience with invoicing international customers
• Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
• Presents ideas and information in a concise, well organized manner
• Manage and prioritize multiple tasks to meet deadlines
• Passion for excellence and continuous improvement and team development
• Experience with NetSuite and Salesforce or similar platforms is required

Lyniate provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

c2dcbb1564e6f59c,2020-08-01 15:31:00 UTC,"Waltham, MA 02451",Account+Management,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Managing Consultant – Value and Access Consulting,"<div class=""jobsearch-jobDescriptionText"" id=""jobDescriptionText""><ul>
• We are looking to fill this role in one of our Waltham, MA offices, we will consider locations based on the candidates’ experience and qualifications.
The Company

Evidera is a global research and consulting group that partners with life science companies worldwide to develop, capture, and communicate the clinical and economic evidence required to demonstrate the real-world effectiveness, safety, and value of their products. Our services are driven by world-class science and thought leadership, and leverage a unique combination of capabilities in clinical development, regulatory consulting, HTA, health economics, outcomes research, market access and real-world evidence.
The Team

The complex and rapidly-changing payer environment is becoming increasingly difficult to navigate. Our expert Value and Access practice, comprising industry leaders, former payers, policy experts, and experienced strategists, help clients steer a path through diverse evidence requirements and potential payer barriers to achieve optimal price and access. Dedicated Value and Access teams in London and Waltham, MA, have been providing global payer research and pricing, Health Technology Assessment (HTA), reimbursement and market access strategy advice to clients in the biopharmaceutical industry for two decades. Our work is underpinned by relationships with high level payers and advisers covering 45 markets, and integration with world-class experts across clinical development, regulatory, HTA, market access, HEOR and RWE practices.
The Role

We have an opportunity for a Managing Consultant to join our Value and Access Consulting team as a senior project manager for client engagements, actively contributing to business development, and support all aspects of developing the Value and Access practice. The role reports to a Principal in the Value and Access Consulting senior leadership team with the primary areas of responsibility outlined below:
<ul>

• Senior project manager providing leadership to project teams of Sr. Consultants, Consultants and Analysts in the development to drive successful delivery and project performance across service categories for large project engagements inclusive of consulting programs (across business practices in Evidera) with support from the Project Lead e.g.

• For early pipeline assets: Global pricing and market access strategy (with US focus), value and evidence strategy and plans, integrated scientific advice for evidence generation optimization, in-licensing decision support and early pricing/global pricing strategy

• For launch and in-line assets: Value story development and testing, payer advisory boards and engagement plans, payer negotiation and workshops and development of strategy and implementation for country specific pricing and reimbursement
• Line management, coaching, mentoring, recruitment and talent training and development responsibilities with a focus on continuous improvement

• Represents team on the weekly practice managers meeting to support operations and resourcing of consulting practice taking leadership for an assigned initiative to support operational excellence in the practice

• Contribute to business development by generating repeat business on large project engagements, contributing to external thought leadership, developing new sales with support of senior leadership, contributing to the development of consulting offerings, and to the visibility and positioning of the consulting practice

• Develop proposals that understand the client need presenting a robust situational analysis and solution with limited senior leadership support. Experience providing an approach that will provide compelling insight and high client satisfaction for the proposed project engagement
Who you are
<ul>
• Strong experience in pricing, reimbursement and global market access either in a consultancy or industry (corporate-level) and highly engaged in expanding your knowledge
• Strategic thinker with ability to understand customer challenges
• Well-developed problem-solving skills and sound judgement
• Experience in business development, including account management
• Line management experience or experience with driving team processes/training, ideally
What we offer
<ul>
• Opportunity to progress your consulting career, increase responsibility and build expertise in an established pricing and market access team with outstanding knowledge and client relationships
• An environment in which you can develop internal engagement - including line management and wider team management skills - in a collaborative, supportive framework
• Space and encouragement to own and shape client relationships with the aim of significantly contributing to new and wider business opportunities
• The ability to work closely with a leadership team drawn from industry executives and ex-payers
• The opportunity to make a difference in supporting our clients in shaping product investment decisions that optimize pricing, reimbursement and market access

• Access to the broader Evidera PPD team of world-class experts in regulatory, clinical development, HTA, health economics, outcomes research, data analytics, and epidemiology services that allow us to make powerful and actionable evidence recommendations
How to Apply

If you resonate with our core competencies and want to contribute to research and consulting services driven by world-class science and thought leadership, then please submit your application – we’d love to hear from you.
Please complete your online profile by attaching your CV and covering letter addressing your suitability for the role.

Weiss Asset Management (WAM), a Boston-based investment firm, is seeking a Quantitative Research Analyst to to support senior investment professionals. Passion and experience in quantitative research are preferred, but we will consider candidates with relevant academic backgrounds. A successful candidate will be an independent thinker, but will thrive in a collaborate environment and employ strong written and verbal communication to integrate with the broader investment team.
Responsibilities:
<ul>
• Identifying novel sources of and uses for data in investment decision making.
• Running studies and building reports to improve existing quantitative studies.
• Back-testing, implementing, managing, and developing quantitative strategies.
• Assembling and maintaining data sets.
• Reading academic papers and financial documents, and identifying portions of economic significance.
• Investigating trends and investments of competitors in the hedge fund space.
An Ideal Candidate Would Have:
<ul>
• Degree in quantitative or scientific field, either of a graduate level or a bachelors with at least one year's experience doing quantitative research in a rigorous environment.
• Fluency with (or ability to quickly develop fluency with) R and Python.
• Interest in the application of statistical methods to solving investment problems, exploring for additional sources of data and thinking creatively about alternatives uses of data.
• Strong interest in understanding market events by exploring and interpreting data.
• Systematic and clear approach to documentation of results and research.
About the company:

Weiss Asset Management is a Boston-based investment firm whose hedge funds and institutional accounts invest approximately $2 billion globally. For over 25 years, WAM has developed proprietary value-based strategies designed to deliver top-tier returns to its investors, which include charitable foundations, pension plans, endowments, hospitals, government entities and private investors. Our collaborative culture and our analytically rigorous approach to problem solving foster cutting-edge academic and industry research.

Above all else, we value integrity, uncompromising rationality, creativity and entrepreneurship, and continuous learning and improvement. Our team of over 80 individuals is the engine of our success and we welcome truly exceptional candidates from all backgrounds.
WAM is a fit for you if:
<ul>

• You enjoy a collaborative environment, where decisions are made in diverse teams. At WAM, all employees can expect to work directly with members of other departments representing a range of backgrounds.

• You work well in a flat structure and are comfortable voicing dissenting opinion. Talent and work ethic, not titles, will dictate what you can achieve at WAM, as evidenced by the fact that 3 of our 4 managing directors began their careers here as interns.
• You are driven to constantly learn, improve, and make rational decisions based in fact, and you welcome receiving feedback as well as sharing knowledge with others.
• You prioritize acting ethically in all situations.

WAM is an equal opportunity employer.

At Notarize, we’re pulling the future closer. As the first company to complete a legal online notarization, online mortgage closing, online will, online auto sale, and countless other critical transactions, we’re proud of our role in bringing industries into the digital age.
<div>

Our business has grown exponentially (over 400%) the past few months, as companies in a wide variety of industries look to us to help their customers get crucial legal transactions processed remotely. We’ve been dealing with a number of challenging (but interesting!) scalability issues, as more and more global enterprise companies look to Notarize to help them speed up business processes and provide better customer service in a new, fully-remote world.
<div>

As an Onboarding Specialist, you will sit at the intersection of Customer Success, Engineering, and Product and help facilitate tighter collaboration between those teams. You will also directly support a number of key projects focused on driving efficiencies both for our customers and internal stakeholders. While this role will be both internal and external facing, and it will provide pathing opportunities both within our Customer Success and Solutions organizations.
Your responsibilities as our Onboarding Specialist include:
Maintaining and improving customer implementation guides
Aggregating and submitting customer and developer feedback to engineering for needed changes
Working with Customer Success, Sales and Marketing to define and drive key support documents for developers
Handling technical escalations from frontline support
Managing and updating document template libraries
Establishing and maintaining clear records of account-level integrations/implementations
Executing certain account- and transaction-level interventions/updates currently owned by on-call engineering
Building playbooks outlining the proper handling of repeat requests and cases
Advocating for new admin and UI features to facilitate more efficient handling of repeat requests and cases
You have:
2+ years in a technical support, sales engineering, solutions architect, or web development position
Effective communications skills and comfort presenting to all roles and levels within an organization
Strict attention to detail
Some familiarity with Ruby and/or REST APIs

Competitive salaries &amp

column1: Our core values:

Solve Problems That Matter: We serve some of the most important moments in people's lives. It's a responsibility we embrace by focusing obsessively on the issues that will have a quantifiable impact on our customers and our company growth.

Yes Before No: We are optimistic about our ability to change lives by transforming outmoded processes. We believe our efforts can create a better future, and it is our attitude that will allow us to pull that future closer.

Start With Why: We don't presume to understand the intentions of the people around us, whether coworkers or customers. We ask honest questions and listen to feedback in order to gain insight, build trust, and create memorable experiences.

Stamp Together: We create a strong team and a welcoming workplace by valuing diverse perspectives. Every role in our organization is supported and valued equally, without regard to location or background.

Job_Description_Summary: PayPal Checkout API Team Serves $100+B in payment volumes across 200+ countries. We are creating a world where ‘payments’ is synonymous with PayPal. The PayPal Platform is a suite of web services, which are used by internal and external developers to enable payments anytime, anywhere and anyway. The Platform processes billions of requests each month, and enables PayPal and its partners to rapidly innovate on new payment scenarios and enable new experiences. Therefore, the evolution of the Platform is integral to PayPal’s long-term strategy. As an engineer in our development team you will be responsible for the development and delivery of the web services supporting PayPal APIs and user experiences on various channels (web, mobile, etc.), as well as integrations with partners. You will work closely with product and experience and/or integration teams to understand the developer needs and deliver the APIs that meets their needs.

Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 286 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.",PayPal

At Blueprint Medicines, we are creating a blueprint for the future of healthcare. We are a leading company in the personalized medicine revolution by focusing on delivering new medicines that are targeted to the genetic driver of disease. We do this by leveraging our one-of-a-kind drug discovery platform to discover, develop and work to bring highly-selective kinase inhibitors to patients globally. This prolific scientific platform has enabled Blueprint Medicines to build a pipeline of novel therapies that span three distinct areas of medicine
column2: genomically defined cancers, rare diseases and cancer immunotherapy.

column1: Job Summary:

This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced, hands-on, leader to help build Blueprint’s software development capabilities. This position will lead and grow a performance-driven software development team to develop new and innovative ways to bring information to our users and enable timely, data-driven decision-making. This position will report to the VP of Information System. Join our team and help us make a positive impact on patients lives!

Lead and grow a high performing, customer-focused web applications development team

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Blueprint Medicines’ mission is to dramatically improve the lives of patients with genomically defined diseases. Our singular focus is to use our deep understanding of the genetic blueprint of cancer and other diseases driven by the abnormal activation of kinases to craft highly selective medicines aimed at eradicating these diseases.
We don’t think in small steps. We think in giant leaps.

We know that what each and every one of us does matters and that our success depends on our ability to work together. Position Title: Senior Software Engineer - Android
Description:

Upon joining our team, you'll help lead the development of a world-class, highly scalable Android application for our engagement and behavior change platform. You'll get to work with product managers, graphic designers and software engineers to take features through the software development lifecycle and put them into the hands of thousands of users. This includes collaborating with backend and DevOps engineers to deliver solutions that are holistically efficient, secure, monitored, and maintainable. Ownership, self-motivation, teamwork, and experience working in a fast-paced agile environment are highly desired.
Key Responsibilities:
<ul>
• Consistently deliver new user interface functionality aligned with design and product requirements in a rapid, high-quality manner

• Guide and lead the curation of our Kotlin-based Android native mobile application codebase, ensuring quality craftsmanship and well structured architecture as our application grows both in user base and features
• Take ownership of key user interface components and functionality, promoting best practices and architectures to improve the quality and maintainability of Well's Android application
• Work with the design team to evaluate designs, reduce complexity, and decrease time to market for user interface enhancements and features
• Help us achieve operational excellence in the software development lifecycle by participating in code reviews, quality assurance, and production monitoring duties
• Contribute to a modern Android codebase utilizing technologies such as Kotlin, RxJava, CoRoutines, Figma, Zeplin, etc
• Operate with a start-up like mentality and desire to take ownership and innovate at pace
• Strive to meet committed timelines to enable the company's go-to-market strategy
Preferred Qualifications:
<ul>
• Eligible to work in the U.S.
• 5+ years of Android Software Development experience
• Experience in the build out and support of a modern mobile application at scale
• Experience in Kotlin and its best practices
• Experience shaping and evolving production-grade codebases in mobile development
• Experience with using open source libraries to expedite delivery of an application
• Experience consuming a variety of APIs and interactions with backend processes
• Proven experience in rapid mobile development at scale while preserving an innovative mindset
• Experience working with teams utilizing modern infrastructure, cloud, and information security systems and techniques
• Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
• Experience mentoring and guiding more junior members of the team
• Ability to navigate a start-up atmosphere
• Build distribution experience with tools such as Bitrise, TestFlight, Firebase, etc.
• Thorough knowledge of the Android ecosystem's best practices
Education:
Bachelor's degree in engineering, science or equivalent work experience

Well is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. We seek diversity and encourage individuals from underrepresented groups to apply.

",Well

Our DevOps Consultants help customers move to Azure and deliver value faster. New Signature's consultants build custom cloud-first software, provide DevOps and Azure consulting, and build internal tools and products to deliver New Signature's message to lead our customers towards best practices.

• Work with project management to deliver software projects following Scrum or Kanban and provide visibility on delivery scope, timelines, and expectations
• Adherence to New Signature and Client Information Security policies shall be met and followed at all times
What experience do you need to be successful in this role?
• Skilled in Azure DevOps (formerly VSTS) core functions: automation, advisory, team and project structure, integration and deployment.

• Expertise with ARM templates, CI / CD, Test automation, database deployment with Redgate tools and Azure Automated Deployments
What personality traits and other capabilities are important for this role?

Does the role require travel?

Security Responsibility:
All employees must act in accordance with New Signature's corporate security standards.
ABOUT NEW SIGNATURE

New Signature is a cloud-first, full-service Microsoft partner committed to delivering innovative technology solutions that solve human challenges. Behind every interaction is our dedication to provide outstanding experiences and to build authentic relationships with those around us. We are passionate about driving transformational results for clients across all company sizes, geographies and industries. The New Signature team delivers full lifecycle solutions—from project inception and planning, through deployment to ongoing support and maintenance.

New Signature was named the top Microsoft partner in the United States and the United Kingdom in 2014 and again in the United States in 2015—becoming the first partner ever to win the prestigious US Partner of the Year award two years in a row. With over 600 individual technology certifications, New Signature is a recognized expert at the forefront of Microsoft advancements and couples these powerful technologies with exceptional services to empower our customers, colleagues, and community.
OUR CORE VALUES

Our employees are driven by our values and know that they make a positive difference every time that they help a customer to solve their challenges. Our focus on delivering great customer experiences empowers our people to build rewarding relationships that contribute to our positive work environment. You can learn more about our culture here: New Signature Culture
<div><div>
<div>
Human
We use our hearts and minds to collaborate for success.

We harness technology to drive business, but we never let that replace our human connections. We use our hearts and minds to collaborate for success and instill confidence in our customers through relationships forged from trust.
Generous
We are giving and respectful.

With our efforts to always be generous, we elevate our service level with empathetic and considerate communications and actions. We always find a way to support our customers and colleagues by giving of our time and talent and equally respecting the time and talent of others.
Authentic
We tell it as it is, with positive intent.

Being authentic helps to nurture our strong and trusted relationships. We are honest, transparent, and reliable. When you partner with New Signature, you are partnering with a group of purposeful, outcome-driven and results-oriented professionals.
Innovative
We push the boundaries at the intersection of people, process and technology.

For us, there are no limit to our dreams. We continually innovate and push boundaries at the intersection of people, process, and technology to bring our customers and colleagues the best solutions first.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

As a Global Cloud Transformation Consultancy business, New Signature understands diversity and inclusion in the workplace brings benefits to our customers, our business and most importantly, our people. New Signature is an Equal Opportunity Employer. New Signature prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other factors protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including all aspects of the recruiting and employment life-cycle at New Signature.
EMPLOYMENT ELIGIBILITY

New Signature requires the candidate to prove eligibility to work in the United States or Canada (depending on the location of the job) within three days of being employed. All final candidates will be asked to complete a background check in both the US and Canada as permitted by location-specific employment eligibility regulations. Depending on the requirements of the job and your location, these record checks may include any or all of the following: education verification, employment verification, drug screening, and criminal record check. Positions that require significant travel may also require a driving record check.

For US Applicants: New Signature is an E-Verify employer. E-Verify is a web-based system that allows enrolled employers to confirm the eligibility of their employees to work in the United States. E-Verify employers verify the identity and employment eligibility of newly hired employees by electronically matching information provided by employees on the Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, against records available to the Social Security Administration (SSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). E-Verify is only used upon acceptance of a job offer and completion of the Form I-9.

For Canadian Applicants: New Signature is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, New Signature will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call 416.971.4267. fcfe4f8023eab618,2020-08-01 23:23:00 UTC,"Boston, MA",software+developer,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Site Reliability Engineer,"

What’s your mission?

IronNet’s mission is simple: To deliver the power of collective cybersecurity to defend companies, sectors, and nations. For decades, companies have been defending against cyber attacks on their own while adversaries have been organizing themselves into sophisticated hacker networks … until now, with IronNet Collective Defense. In 2014, General (Ret) Keith Alexander, former Commander U.S. Cyber Command, launched IronNet to strengthen cybersecurity defense against highly sophisticated adversaries, across all borders and sectors.

In response to cyber adversaries who increasingly collaborate for collective offense, leading organizations in our critical infrastructure are using collective defense strategies and solutions to meet these powerful and ever-changing threats. We believe that collective defense is our collective responsibility and we are leading the charge.

We are looking for a very well-rounded, experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join a team of SREs dedicated to support and improvement of our back end and sensor platforms. We work on petabyte-scale distributed systems. This person must dive deep into operational issues, from systems, automation, and process perspectives. The candidate will understand the challenges around integrating disparate infrastructures into a new facility and new processes and procedures.
Responsibilities
Daily customer interaction ensuring the health and maintenance of customer’s stack: hardware, software, application and network are operating in peak performance
Perform deep dives into both systemic and latent reliability issues
column2: partner with software and systems engineers across the organization to produce and roll out fixes

column1: Troubleshoot issues across the entire stack: hardware, software, application and network
Drive standardization efforts across multiple disciplines and services in conjunction with embedded SREs throughout the organization
Identify and drive opportunities to improve automation for the company
column2: scope and create automation for deployment, management and visibility of our services

column1: Represent the SRE organization in design reviews and operational readiness exercises for new and existing services
Work with software engineers and development SRE's to improve upon deployment processes.
Requirements
Sound fundamentals in operating systems, networking, and distributed systems
Strong familiarity with Linux systems administration and management / best practices
Familiarity with OS container technology: Docker, LXC, namespaces/cgroups
Strong understanding of: Ethernet, VLAN, IPv4/IPv6, ARP, DHCP, DNS, and TCP
Familiarity with distributed system problems: leader election, consensus, etc.
STIG familiarity is a plus
Solid understanding of systems and application design, including the operational trade-offs of various designs
Expert level understanding with at least one public or private cloud technology such as Amazon AWS or OpenStack
Practical knowledge of various aspects of service design, including messaging protocols &amp
column2: behavior, caching strategies and software design practices

column1: Practical, intermediate knowledge of shell scripting, some python is a plus
Demonstrable knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, web application security, and experience supporting multi-tier web application architectures
Excellent knowledge of Linux/UNIX systems administration and performance tuning
Comfortable configuring DNS, DHCP, and LAN/WAN technologies
Minimum 5 years of managing services in an internet scale *nix environment
Must work well with and be able to influence myriad personalities at all levels

274dcc61ca3a30af,2020-08-01 15:29:00 UTC,"Danvers, MA",Customer+Representative,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Full-Time Customer Advocate Field Operations,"

ABOUT CARVANA….

At Carvana, we sell cars, but we're not salespeople. Since 2013, we've been making it our mission to change the way people buy cars. We saw a huge problem with how much it can suck to buy a car the traditional way, so we committed ourselves to tackling one of the largest, yet-to-be-disrupted markets in the world – the $1T per year U.S. car market (yes, that's $Trillion with a ""T"").

With the ability to search thousands of vehicles from our expansive inventory, to high-resolution 360° photographs of our vehicles' interior and exterior, to real-time financing and the ability to complete contracts without visiting the back room of a dealership, we provide a seamless, online car buying experience for consumers that can be completed from their desktop or mobile device. All our vehicles are inspected and reconditioned based on our 150-point certification checklist and come with a 7-day return policy. We also operate our own logistics network to deliver cars to customers as soon as the next day, as well as offer customer pick-up at our state-of-the-art Car Vending Machine locations (yes, you read that right). By putting customer satisfaction at the core of our business, we've built a no-pressure, no-haggle online car buying experience that save our customers time and money.
For more information on Carvana, take a look at our company introduction video.
WORKING AT CARVANA YOU WILL NOTICE THAT...
You'll need to be a great communicator, a brand ambassador, and possess the know how to get the job done.
We expect bright people, willing to roll up their sleeves, take on new assignments, and juggle many things at once.

In return for your hard work, you'll have an opportunity to work at one of the fastest growing and creative technology companies around, as well as help us promote a life-changing product and develop a world-class team every day. In our down time we have ping pong and corn hole (or ""bags,"" depending on where you're from) tournaments. However, the pace is pretty quick around here, so you'll need to be prepared to keep up.
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Customer Advocate role is a unique combination of a few different things but long story short, you'll be the face of Carvana. Since Carvana's purchase process is entirely online, meeting you to receive their newly purchased vehicle will likely be the first time a customer has met a Carvana employee face-to-face! You'll have the freedom to go above and beyond to ensure our customers have an experience that doesn't suck and is completely one of a kind.
SPECIFICALLY, YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:
<ul>
• Delivering a uniquely special experience to each and every one of our customers. Minus the red suit, you'll pretty much be a real-life Santa Claus on a daily basis!

• A major part of this job is driving a kick-ass single-car hauler to get the customer's purchase delivered straight to their front door. You don't need a commercial driver's license to drive the hauler and don't worry, with a little training, you'll realize driving the hauler is a piece of cake.

• Not only will you be driving that kick-ass car hauler, but you will also be loading and unloading the customer's vehicle on and off of it (it's a quick and easy process, but it does require getting a little physical) and inspecting the car-hauler to ensure the vehicle maintains good maintenance and safe driving conditions.
• You'll be expected to prioritize safe driving and to maintain a clean driving record in accordance to Carvana's CMV Driver Qualification policy. Consistent, safe driving is crucial to this role!

• You will be accurately and efficiently completing customer paperwork as well as taking thorough notes in our customer tracking system. Again, don't worry, we'll train you on the paperwork, however you do need a natural eye for detail!
• You'll also be a team player by assisting other team members with various tasks as necessary.
• Like we mentioned, the Customer Advocate role is a unique combination of a few different things. So there likely will be other duties assigned too.
A QUALIFYING CANDIDATE MUST HAVE…

This position requires a sense of humor and a passion for the customer experience. We are looking for someone who is goal-oriented, enthusiastic, energetic and self-motivated. Required knowledge, skills and abilities include:
<ul>
• High School Diploma or equivalent, Bachelor's Degree is preferred
• Must be 21 years of age or older
• Must have a valid Driver's License with a clean driving record for the past 3 years
• 2+ years of customer facing experience with a passion for creating memorable customer experiences
• Is a team player and has an understanding of the value of teamwork and how teams work
• Has a heightened sense of urgency, a strong attention to detail and is able to communicate our customer offerings in a clear and consistent manner

01c82d7d0ad6add2,2020-08-01 15:29:00 UTC,"Boston, MA 02101",Customer+Representative,Boston,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,"Genetic Analysis Sales Representative, Greater Boston","

The Genetic Analysis Sales Representative, Greater Boston position is part of the commercial organization supporting the Genetic Sciences Division (GSD) portfolio which provides high-value genomic data to assist critical decisions in research and applied markets - Quantitative PCR | Sanger Sequencing | Human Identification | AgriGenomics.
Based remotely to cover the Greater Boston, MA area.
Position Summary: Genetic Analysis Sales Representative, Greater Boston

This position is a field sales based position responsible for achieving or exceeding the assigned territory sales plan. The Genetic Analysis Sales Representative will have a strong technical acumen in the areas of qPCR, sequencing (Sanger) and microarray. The Genetic Analysis Sales Representative will demonstrate technical credibility to effectively consult with customers to influence key decisions on technology and product choices. Strong sales and business acumen is also required to build successful account and territory plans and translate territory strategy into business results. Required skills for this position include
column2: selling experience in Biotech Pharma and Clinical accounts, technical familiarity with product lines and markets, funnel management and forecasting.

column1: What will you do?

Demonstrates technical ability to consult with customers on applications to maximize technology utilization and promote current advances in protocols, kits and capabilities. Understands and navigates competitive offerings to best position solutions.

Consumable Sales Acumen- Successfully drives reagent throughput and attachment rates, driving enhanced utilization of qPCR, sequencing and microarray technologies. Consult with customers to build relationships and focus on project needs and workflows to maximize consumable usage.
Commitment to rigorous territory planning, market knowledge, both accurate and timely forecasting- for both run rate and big deal/project based instrument and consumable orders.
Team Work- Successful experience working in a team environment.
Develops and manages a business plan to meet or exceed business goals agreed upon with Thermo Fisher Scientific commercial management for the territory.
Effectively competes to win projects vs. competitors. Successfully position our solutions to address performance, workflow and budget.

Manage instrument install base and consumable utilization. Target customers not using our instruments and consumables. Identify the applications, reagents, assays and protocols available and convert the business.

Consistently and accurately manages sales process including sales forecasting, pipeline management, and sales tracking through the use of our customer relationship management program and other designated IT tools.
Develops and maintains current knowledge of genetic analysis markets, products and buying practices required to effectively compete in the assigned territory.
Utilizes product and application knowledge across the genetic analysis portfolio to successfully conduct consultative and strategic selling presentations.
Understands customer goals, priorities and challenges such that our company solutions are best positions to address customer needs.
How will you get here?
Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Biology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry or related field. A Master’s or PhD degree is desirable.
• Requires a minimum of 3 years field sales experience in Life Sciences.
Experience selling Capital equipment and large account management experience preferred.
Extensive knowledge of qPCR, sequencing, and/or microarray is preferred.
• Knowledge of accounts in territory is preferred.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

",Thermo Fisher Scientific

At ASICS, we empower our employees to pursue their career goals. If this sounds like you, then we want you on our team.

ASICS has been dedicated to designing the most technically advanced footwear and athletic products in the world for over 60 years. All of that comfort, fit, and functionality starts within the minds of the passionate people that work within our walls.

Based upon our core values, everyone's input and contributions are respected at ASICS America. We nurture a collaborative environment and hire team members that are never content, always pushing through their own limitations, continually in the pursuit of improving performance, are innovative and creative, reach for new challenges, and always aim to surpass the next goal.
Our Mission: We pledge to bring harmony to the body and soul

ASICS, an acronym derived from the Latin phrase, Anima Sana In Corpore Sano - a sound mind in a sound body. Staying true to the philosophy by which it was founded, every ASICS innovation, every concept, every idea is intended to create the best product.
