HomeAdvisor and our sister company, Angie's List, have combined to create the largest home services marketplace in the nation. Part of ANGI Homeservices (ANGI), we connect millions of homeowners across the globe with home service professionals through our innovative and user-friendly products. ANGI Homeservices operates 10 brands in eight countries, and is headquartered in Denver, CO. We are currently seeking an experienced Account Manager to join our B2B Strategic Partnerships team.
The Job:

We are looking for a Strategic Partnerships Account Manager who has a passion for developing customer relationships and driving incremental business from their existing customer portfolio. The ideal candidate will be a hard-working, driven individual that will play a key role in creating significant revenue growth by driving relationships with our largest national partners. You will report to the Director of Strategic Partnerships.
The Team:

The Strategic Partnerships team is responsible for creating and managing programs that increase service professional acquisition and retention into the HomeAdvisor and Angie's networks. We work closely with our partners to provide strategic guidance and best practices to increase overall program success. We manage relationships that secure millions of dollars in revenue each year, and with that comes an opportunity to be part of a dynamic team that plays a pivotal role in the overall growth of the company.
Responsibilities:

As an Account Manager, Strategic Partnerships in the B2B Marketing group, you will be managing relationships with some of the largest contractors in the industry. Your day in the life is focused on collaborating with leaders of large associations, manufacturers and franchise networks on marketing strategies to help their members (service professionals) successfully use HomeAdvisor and Angie's List to grow their business. Each strategic partner is different, and each approach is unique, so you start by analyzing the current relationship, then coordinating with key internal groups to assemble optimal solutions. Through a combination of executive interactions, user webinars, trade shows, and face-to-face meetings with your clients, you're moving the ball forward, leveraging new ideas and, ultimately, strengthening our partnerships through strategic and thoughtful plans. In addition, you will manage direct reports, helping them grow their own portfolio by providing strategic guidance and support.
Essential Functions:
<ul>
• Analyze a portfolio of our largest service professional customers to identify growth and upselling opportunities
<li>Think strategically to identify opportunities uniquely tailored to each partner in your portfolio and proactively creative offer solutions to grow accounts by maximizing HomeAdvisor products &amp
column2: services to best fit each partner's needs

column1: • Manage and provide frequent guidance to this select group of service professionals to ensure they see success with our services
• Develop and maintain personal relationships, allowing you to effectively grow and retain our top contractors and navigate tough conversations about their ROI with ease
• Effectively communicate with management the status of accounts, including risks and opportunities
Desired Skills:
<ul>
• You are tactful and resilient in challenging situations, analytical in solving problems, and innovative in evaluating new opportunities for growth
• You have a positive attitude when working with both clients and internal stakeholders
• You are strategic thinker, with an ability to use data to inform decisions
• You are thoughtful, proactive and self-motivated
• You have a natural desire to learn and keep up with an industry that is always evolving and easily adapt to change
• You are an excellent communicator who enjoys inspiring others, can navigate tough conversations, and is comfortable presenting to executives and large audiences
• You are proficient with Microsoft Office-Excel and PowerPoint
<li>Some travel required
column2: heavier in Q1 and Q3

At HomeAdvisor we create the digital tools and services that empower millions of service professionals to connect with hundreds of millions of homeowners. We are a dual sided marketplace that nurtures growth of the independent small business and delivers a seamless experience in home improvement. As #1 in the Homeservices category, our tremendous scale is the launchpad to boundless inventions in technology and product!

HomeAdvisor is the self-contained operating business of ANGI Homeservices (NASDAQ: ANGI), a federation of spirited technology companies that build for a better economy. CapTech is a team of master builders, creators, and problem solvers who help clients grow efficient, successful businesses. We unite diverse skills and perspectives to transform how data, systems, and ingenuity enable each client to advance what’s possible in a changing world.

As perceptive partners, our U.S-based consultants find inspiration in the unknown and enjoy getting our hands dirty solving our clients’ myriad of challenges. Across industries and business goals, we fuse technical depth and analytical prowess with creative savvy to move clients forward. This drive helps each organization use technology, management, and insight to turn ideas into action. Together, we create outcomes that exceed the expected — which is one of the reasons we’ve been on the Inc. 500/5000 list for over a decade.
Job Description

As a Senior DevOps Lead you will be tasked with leading DevOps transformations for large and complex client environments. You’ll provide leadership to the DevOps Service Offering both locally and across CapTech’s Systems Integration Practice. Additional responses are outlined below.

Perform DevOps assessments at the Enterprise level

Provides guidance for training and career development based on current trends
Experience working with senior leadership to align DevOps capabilities with business strategy and objectives

CI/CD
Automated testing
DevSecOps
Telemetry
Quality Gates
Prior experience leading Software Engineers

Experience deploying and administering Continuous Integration tools such as Jenkins, TFS, TeamCity or Bamboo
Strong understanding and be experience operating in an agile development environment
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Excellent problem-solving skills

Preferred Skills
Proven experience leading large complex DevOps transformations – moved from required

SAFE DevOps Certification

We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.

At PointsBet, we have only built a fraction of what we have imagined.

Data and Engineering are the life blood of our company and a key factor to our success in one the largest emerging U.S. markets – the competitive, multibillion-dollar industry of sports betting. Our work is complex, challenging and rewarding while touching on areas like software engineering, data science, governance, large-scale distributed systems and user behavior, to name a few.

We place no limits on our team’s ability to create and develop software that reimagines the status quo. As a challenger brand that prioritizes ownership of our core technology end-to-end, we control our own product roadmap and always strive to offer the quickest and most user-friendly app (iOS and Android) using React and React Native calling cloud-hosted microservices. In short, we are a cutting-edge sportsbook operator that is obsessed with constant product and tech-driven innovation to further amplify our user experience.

We are currently looking for a Back End Software Engineer to join our growing Denver team. This position is best suited for a candidate who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a passion for developing endless user solutions. Your work will make a tangible, real-life impact every single month.

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

  • Work closely with members of software engineering and product teams to build new features and enhancements.
  • Adhere to best practices in terms of code quality, test and development practices.
  • Design and implement efficient, intuitive, modular and testable code.
  • Learn, adhere and contribute to solution design, coding practice, testing and other processes all throughout the SDLC.

SKILLS WE SEEK

  • Masters or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or technology-related discipline) from a reputable university
  • Proficient in C#, .NET Core API development with minimum 3 yrs experience
  • Proficient in SQL with minimum 3 yrs experience
  • Azure cloud platform experience preferred
  • Minimum 3-year real world demonstrable experience building distributed applications.
  • Experience in queueing solutions and event driven architecture is a plus
  • Understanding of best coding practices (SRP, DRY, decoupling, TDD, BDD)
  • Experience in CI/CD process preferred
  • Open minded and fast learner
  • Passionate about software development and modern software architecture, and sharing the passion with others

About PointsBet

Launched in the United States in January 2019, PointsBet is one of the fastest growing sportsbooks in the country and is rapidly expanding its U.S. footprint. Originally founded in Australia, PointsBet is a cutting-edge sportsbook operator that prides itself on having the quickest and most user-friendly app (iOS and Android) while also providing the best content and experience for sports bettors.

Currently operational in New Jersey, Indiana and Iowa, PointsBet has partnerships in place to soon launch elsewhere across the country. Throughout expansion efforts, PointsBet will continue to bring its proprietary and best-in-market technology to emerging sports betting markets.

BENEFITS

Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, 401(k) with a generous match, commuter benefits, and PTO. Located in Downtown Denver just 3 blocks from Union Station.

PointsBet is an Equal Opportunity Employer

  • United States (Required)

  • One location

  • www.pointsbet.com

Spectora is a fast-growing SaaS startup that is looking for a Wordpress Ninja to help build and maintain inspector websites.

This position is entry-level and designed for quick growth in responsibilities, salary and career advancement. Salary is flexible depending on experience, skill set and the right candidate.

We have a highly accountable remote culture that is flexible and focused on productivity. In addition to our ""take what you need"" time-off policy, you’ll get a stipend to outfit your home office, a monthly health &
column2:
wellness reimbursement and quarterly retreats.

*If you're looking for a steady job where you can just put in an unengaged 40 hours and coast, this isn't for you. There is opportunity to rapidly grow your skill set, salary and bonuses quickly if you're ready to put in the work*

About the Job

You will be working under our Web Hosting Manager to primarily build new customer websites and make edits for our existing hosting subscribers.

Building Wordpress Websites - We have demos and templates we work from but you'll be able to work in your creative touch!

Customer Service - We deliver excellent value with our websites and client feedback is critical to this. You'll patiently go through feedback rounds with our clients to get the website where they feel great about it.

Service Existing Customers - You'll make updates and edits for existing customers.

*Marketing - If you have interest in digital marketing, writing or social media this is a plus.

Qualifications &
column3:

Wordpress Experience - Be prepared to send us examples of Wordpress sites you have built and why you enjoy building!

Customer Service- Experience dealing with customers is a must. We're looking for someone that has empathy, knows how to ask questions and listen, and is a lifelong learner.

Hard-working, Fun-loving Personality- This is the best part about startups. The work is rewarding, the growth potential is there, and we actually enjoy working together.

Technical Knowledge -You must have a baseline understanding of mobile apps, browsers, and how SaaS products work. Our web services are tightly integrated with our core SaaS platform. You'll often have to describe technical topics to non-technical users.

e0b73b5286eb87a4,2020-08-01 23:24:00 UTC,"Denver, CO 80202 (Union Station area)",software+developer,Denver,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Software Engineer - Full Stack,"

At PointsBet, we have only built a fraction of what we have imagined.

Data and Engineering are the life blood of our company and a key factor to our success in one the largest emerging U.S. markets – the competitive, multibillion-dollar industry of sports betting. Our work is complex, challenging and rewarding while touching on areas like software engineering, data science, governance, large-scale distributed systems and user behavior, to name a few.

We place no limits on our team’s ability to create and develop software that reimagines the status quo. As a challenger brand that prioritizes ownership of our core technology end-to-end, we control our own product roadmap and always strive to offer the quickest and most user-friendly app (iOS and Android) using React and React Native calling cloud-hosted microservices. In short, we are a cutting-edge sportsbook operator that is obsessed with constant product and tech-driven innovation to further amplify our user experience.

We are seeking a Software Engineer – Full Stack for our US based technology team with headquarters in Denver, CO. In this role, you will be a core member of the Advanced Technology team and contribute to the design, development and implementation of full stack enterprise applications (web and/or mobile) in close collaboration with Product Management, Technology, and Operations teams. An ideal candidate will be a highly organized self-starter, an experienced Agile practitioner, and with a passion for DevOps culture and modern CI/CD deployment practices.

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

  • Design and deliver intuitive solutions for the business stakeholders in collaboration with Product Management and other Technology teams.
  • Collaborate with Software Engineers, DevOps Engineers, UX Designers, ML Engineers to conceptualize, design and develop products and features for the enterprise.
  • Communicate technical ideas effectively with a focus on solving customer requirements
  • Prototype and develop solutions that drive business process workflow automation utilizing RPA frameworks as appropriate
  • Responsible for adhering to the Company’s information security policies.

SKILLS WE SEEK

  • B.S in Computer Science or equivalent
  • 5+ years of overall enterprise software development experience, including 3+ years of experience building and supporting full-stack applications using Front-end: JavaScript and TypeScript, MV* frameworks (Angular or React/Redux
column2: Back-end: C#, Python or similar
column3: familiarity with modern distributed systems design patterns, Microservices and Serverless design paradigms, concepts such as CQRS and Event Sourcing
column4: SQL/ NOSQL databases
column5: RESTful APIs, cloud-based/enterprise-grade message brokers or streaming platforms
column6:
Container orchestration systems (Docker, Swarm, Kubernetes) - cloud first and on-prem
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure Cloud or AWS or GCS (Azure Preferred)
  • Ability to develop high quality production code by effectively utilizing testing frameworks, SDLC and CI/CD practices
  • Experience using Azure DevOps or JIRA in an Agile/Scrum based product development
  • Experience with RPA frameworks (UiPath, Automation Anywhere or Power Automate) is a plus
  • Passionate about UX design and customer-centric design processes
  • Experience working with global product development teams is a plus
  • The successful candidate will have a great team attitude, strong desire to collaborate and contribute to our culture

    • About PointsBet

    Launched in the United States in January 2019, PointsBet is one of the fastest growing sportsbooks in the country and is rapidly expanding its U.S. footprint. Originally founded in Australia, PointsBet is a cutting-edge sportsbook operator that prides itself on having the quickest and most user-friendly app (iOS and Android) while also providing the best content and experience for sports bettors.

    Currently operational in New Jersey, Indiana and Iowa, PointsBet has partnerships in place to soon launch elsewhere across the country. Throughout expansion efforts, PointsBet will continue to bring its proprietary and best-in-market technology to emerging sports betting markets.

    BENEFITS

    Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, 401(k) with a generous match, commuter benefits, and PTO. Located in Downtown Denver just 3 blocks from Union Station.

    PointsBet is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Candidates will configure, design, test, and analyze issues as they arise. They will also support design and development of new capabilities and provide business finance operation and accounting support to the government client team.
The team

Oracle Enterprise Solutions (OES)

Our Oracle Enterprise Solutions practice provides services from ERP and Cloud Strategy, through Business Transformation and Applications Implementation, to Operate and Cloud Release Management. We modernize our client’s business and core environments to leverage technology innovations around Cloud, Digital, Mobility and Social Collaboration. We help our clients address digital transformation by designing modern applications and industry specific solutions to deliver outcomes that improve flexibility, scalability and cost management. Oracle ERP products include Oracle Cloud SaaS, EBS, PeopleSoft, and JD Edwards.

Professionals can expect to deliver “heart of the business” projects and work closely with client leaders in finance, logistics, manufacturing, shop floor, scheduling, engineering and design, IT, project management as well as the C-suite including the CEO, CFO, CIO and COO. How you’ll grow

Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. 5255864b31b17d72,2020-08-01 23:17:00 UTC,"Arvada, CO 80003",full+stack+developer,Denver,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,Software Developer,"

PlanIT Geo is seeking a Software Developer to join our team. In this role you will work with a small group of dedicated professionals to build TreePlotter software, a leading solution for web-mapping, managing, and analyzing trees and related resources. We are a small company based outside of Denver with employees around the country and partners and customers around the globe. This is an exciting period in our company’s growth, with plenty of opportunity to advance and grow along with us.

TreePlotter INVENTORY, PARKS, and CANOPY compose our existing SaaS platform. Our software is used by local and state governments, private tree care firms, consultants, nonprofits, campuses, and others who work with trees, parks, and natural resources data. Our newest offering, TreePlotter JOBS, is free through November for private tree care firms and consulting arborists, and helps clients estimate win and manage work for trees on residential and commercial properties.

Our full-stack developers are responsible for all software on our platform, built in-house using mostly open source technologies. Successful applicants will be highly proficient in and experienced with
JavaScript for this role, especially client-side, and ideally also with NodeJS. We are open to coders in other languages who can easily adapt, and we aren’t posting this as a JavaScript developer role because we might embrace something new or different as needed (Go, event-sourced, distributed streaming, etc) - we expect all of our developers to be flexible and willing to embrace change. You will begin by working on a stack composed of Vue.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, running in Docker, in the AWS cloud.

You will help our developers grow while continuing to improve yourself and have confidence in the solutions you create and champion. You will keep an open mind to existing solutions and various paths forward. Our developers enjoy writing code and creating great solutions, and work to complete features and software without leaving things half-baked or unfinished, using Agile, producing working software at the end of each iteration.

Remote, work from home - it is 2020! We do have a wonderful office in Arvada that we hope to see again someday, and if you live around Denver you are welcome to work there when we return. We would like to fly you in to visit occasionally if you live elsewhere as we do with all our staff.

Primary Responsibilities of the Position:

- Develop and maintain web-based software using best practices
- Take ownership of code, systems, and processes, always with an eye toward improvement
- Take pride in software that works well, scales without issue, and makes our customers happy
- Assist in our transition to a more test-driven approach and other initiatives around software quality
- Lead and mentor other developers, while being willing to learn from them
- Participate in an evolving Agile development environment emphasizing collaboration

Required Skills and Experience:
_________________________________________________________________________________

- 5+ years of hands-on software development experience
- Solid software engineering fundamentals, from algorithms to design methodology
- A true understanding of OO or functional programming with experience in at least one paradigm, and a willingness to learn and grow your software engineering skills
- Fluency in Javascript, knowledge and interest in other languages
- Web-based software expertise in HTML, CSS, client-side scripting, and responsive design
- Competence in SQL, relational databases, and related concepts, and experience with modern purpose-built DBs (NoSQL, graph, etc)
- Experience with integrations, APIs, and interoperability through standards
- Proficient on Linux/GNU systems, and experience in cloud-based platforms like AWS
- Great with clients, and a firm commitment to maintaining excellent relationships
- You spent at least some time reviewing our sites and systems before applying
- College degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience

Desired Skills and Nice-To-Haves:

- Experience working on multi-tenant SaaS platforms, and SPAs
- Experience designing and developing APIs in a service-based architecture
- Knowledge and experience with NoSQL, graph databases, and other storage technologies and purpose-build DBs
- Experience with event-sourcing, streaming platforms, and functional programming
- Years of experience with Postgres or similar relational databases
- Familiar with mapping/GIS concepts and technologies
- Interest in trees, forestry, natural resource management, sustainability, or urban planning a plus

PlanIT Geo as employee benefits that include health insurance, PTO, and a 401k match.

This is a direct full-time hire with our company, no recuriters, agencies, or contractors please.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
An Inventory Specialist works with and reports to the General Manager and is responsible for HUB operation while performing the following duties. Other duties may be assigned.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Pull and ship HUB orders on time.
If HUB order can’t be filled, call servicing store before next HUB run explaining how to reorder.
Working with store management team, complete all parts department cycle counts including OUTS.
Work with store management team to complete all parts department plan-o-grams.
Work with store management team to stock all parts department parts.
Work with store management team to complete all parts department callbacks.
Work with store management team to complete MAXI changes in parts department.
Comply with all federal, state and local laws.
Comply with all company policies and procedures.
Complete all required training materials, attend all scheduled store meetings.
At General Manager’s direction, train and develop Team Members to help assure the HUB is operated according to company policies and procedures.
Coordinate through General Manager the delivery of product, maintaining inventories, keeping operating records, or preparing daily record of transactions.
Help to ensure compliance of established security, customer service and record keeping policies and procedures.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Must be competent at oral and written communications and handle basic math computations.
Should have prior retail experience, including basic merchandising and inventory management skills.
Able to drive forklift, if certified and applicable, and use a hand truck and pallet jack.
Should be well mannered, neat in appearance and possess the ability to meet and deal with the public in an unbiased manner.
Previous work records should demonstrate stability and performance results.
Scheduling factors necessitate that the individual should be able to come to work on short notice, and/or work flexible hours including nights and weekends.
Immediately report to General Manager and/or District Manager any violation of company policy or procedure.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or GED equivalent
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Almost constant standing or walking.
Must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Requires good manual skills (gross and fine finger dexterity).
Must be able to reach above shoulder level.
Must be capable of squatting, bending and reaching.
Must be capable of climbing, stooping, kneeling, and crouching on an occasional basis.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Inside approximately 95 % of the time
column2: depending upon the time of year, the store is air conditioned or heated accordingly. No particular hazards are involved except exposure to battery acid (eye protection and aprons should be used when handling batteries, although not mandatory). An Inventory Specialist must also adhere to safety precautions when operating a forklift or hand pallet jack.",Advance Auto Parts

• Customer Service/Front Desk Activities:
Greet members and guests, providing exceptional customer service and doing your best to make members feel comfortable and welcomed!
• Answer phones in a friendly manner and assist callers with a variety of questions.
• Check members in, tour and sign up new members, log amenities and communicate updates and events to members and guests.
• Respond to member questions and concerns in a timely and professional manner.
• Conduct beverage or merchandise purchases on the point of sale system.
• Close shift for the business day and create bank deposits for the following day.
• Member Accounts:
Utilize POS system to assist with new membership cards, change of address and billing or payment questions.
• Club Cleanliness and Maintenance:
Go above and beyond to keep the front desk area and lobby clean and orderly.
• Regular facility cleaning and upkeep such as mopping up spills under equipment, trash removal, cleaning windows and mirrors, and re-racking weights.
• Regular cleaning of all exercise equipment and tanning beds.
• Regular restroom and wet area cleaning and stocking.
Qualifications:
• 6-12 months of Customer Service experience is preferred.
• High school diploma/GED equivalent required.
• Must be 18 years of age or older.
• Must be able to work overnight hours (10:00 PM to 6:00 AM).
• Basic computer proficiency with an eye for accuracy.
• Punctuality and reliability is a must.
<li>Exceptional customer service skills
column2: able to interact in a positive and professional way with members and co-workers, exceeding the member’s expectations.

• Continual talking in person or on the phone during shift.

column1: Job Overview
Cleans and prepares guest rooms by meeting established standards of cleanliness and propriety to assure guest satisfaction and maximize revenues.
Responsibilities

Retrieves items from shelves and storerooms, sets up cleaning cart with supplies, constantly maintaining carts and storerooms in a clean and orderly fashion to enhance efficiency and ease of cleaning rooms.

Cleans and wipes windows, doors, walls, closets and fixtures in rooms, public areas and hallways, often using ladders or stools to clean hard to reach areas, in order to maintain a clean, presentable and attractive facility at all times. Washes shower walls and tub, cleans toilet(s) and stall walls if applicable, wipes exposed pipes, cleans mirrors, sink(s) and walls in order to have clean and sanitary guest and public restrooms.
Replaces towels, soaps and all room amenities and restocks literature that has been removed by previous guest or is soiled and torn to ensure adequate supply for arriving guests.
Washes all hard floor areas (linoleum, tile, etc.) by hand to remove dirt and soiled areas.
Dusts and polishes all furniture, fixtures and wall hangings including using a duster to reach vents and ceiling corners to remove dust and cobwebs.
Strips bed of all linen and remakes with fresh, checking bedspread, blankets and bed pads for cleanliness, replacing if soiled.
Lifts mattresses to check for soil between mattresses and under bed.
Checks closet for cleanliness, wiping closet door, handle and overhead shelves and restocking the guest room supplies such as hangers, extra blankets and pillows.

Vacuums rooms, public areas and hallways, operating vacuums weighing up to 25lbs., and lifting/moving heavy furniture in order to vacuum entire area of carpet including underneath furniture and hard to reach areas.
Inspects all door and window locks to ensure they are in working order and immediately alerts management to an unsecured or unsafe situation for the safety of guests and employees.

Inspects all room equipment (TV, lights/lamps, faucets, radios) to ensure proper working order and immediately reports all room status and room maintenance deficiencies, in writing, to the Executive Housekeeper for prompt repair/resolution.
Secures and maintains custody of equipment, keys and supplies at all times in order to protect and preserve hotel property.
Maintains a friendly, cheerful and courteous demeanor at all times.
Performs other duties as assigned, requested or deemed necessary by management
Qualifications
Education/Formal Training
No formal education or training
Experience
None
Knowledge/Skills
Must have basic knowledge of general cleaning principles, use of cleaning products and operation of standard cleaning equipment.
Must be able to understand and follow verbal/written instructions and communicate both verbally and in writing.
Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Must be able to lift up to 50lbs. continually throughout a shift.
Must be able to push, pull and move levers, equipment and furniture throughout a shift.
Must be able to work with arms raised above head throughout a shift.
Must be able to maneuver fully loaded maid cart, weighing up to 50lbs., through hallways and into/out of closets during entire work day.
Ability to identify minute debris and dirt in poorly lit areas, and to read written instructions and computer print-outs.
Environment
Prolonged strenuous physical activity in indoor climate-controlled environment.
Excessive heat and humidity in laundry. Inside 95% of shift.
Position Type: Regular Full-Time
Property : Marriott DTC
Outlet: Hotel
Address : 4900 S Syracuse St
City : Denver
State : Colorado
EOE Protected Veterans/Disability",Sage Hospitality

At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people think about enterprise security technology. With our innovative Identity Defined Security platform, we're building a borderless world where people have total freedom to work wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.

We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that drives our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.

We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado, and we have offices and employees around the globe. And we serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 100. Because even in the most complex enterprise environments, security shouldn't be a source of anxiety. It is one of your greatest competitive advantages.

The Sales Development Rep position is for individuals who are ready to develop challenging pre-sales experience through the identification and qualification of sales opportunities. You’ll work in close collaboration with marketing and enterprise field sales to create revenue pipeline by uncovering and converting leads. You will report to the Manager of Sales Development.
This is an entry-level job where you can start a career in technology sales. SDRs are expected to be in the role for at least one year.
Job Responsibilities:
• Make 50 cold calls per day
• Apply knowledge of Ping’s offerings, market, and trends to uncover sales opportunities
• Work with Sales and Marketing to implement account-based prospecting strategies
• Use technology, such as Salesforce, to contact leads and convert them to sales opportunities
• Achieve quota targets
Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited University (minimum 3.3 GPA)
• About 2 years of experience in a similar role (SDR/TDR/BDR, recruiting, customer service)
• Desire to grow a career in sales
Our Benefits:
• Open PTO
• Parental Leave
• Free Healthcare Option
• 401(k) Match
• Generous Holiday Schedule
• Commuter Offset
• Education Reimbursement

Ping Identity is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

",Ping Identity

column2: Casualty and Life/Health licenses (we PAY for your study materials!)

Department Information
This position is open only to classified permanent employees of the listed department and division within that department.
Description of Job

This new position will provide direct supervision to custodial staff working the swing, night, Weekend day, and graveyard shifts in the Facilities Management Department. Working hours for the Custodian IV are Sunday-Thursday, 2:30 pm - 11:00 pm.

Duties include evaluating performance and overseeing the progressive discipline process, coaching and mentoring, interviewing prospective custodian applicants, making recommendations concerning budget and staffing, developing inventory control systems and equipment repair guidelines, and authorizing and monitoring expenditure of funds and use of resources. Will develop and implement training and development opportunities for Custodian I, II and III to help prepare them for promotional opportunities. Will perform other duties as assigned.
<div><b>Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment &amp
column2: Appeal Rights

column1: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Three years of custodial experience, two of which must have been at the level of a unit supervisor or equivalent. (Part-time experience will be pro-rated.) Must have basic computer skills (word processing and spreadsheets) in order to create schedules, document performance and communicate via email. Requires knowledge of basic budgets and inventory procedures. Must have strong customer service skills, attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks, effective communication skills (oral and written) and strong time management and organizational skills.
Required Competencies
The successful candidate will have:
<ul><li>Knowledge of cleaning and sanitizing methods and procedures as they relate to environmental sanitation and safety practices.
• Exhibited use of chemical cleaning agents and possible hazards as related to environmental sanitation.
• Ability to exert up to 50 lbs. of force frequently to move objects and operate equipment during the execution of job duties.
• Ability to climb, balance, stoop, kneel and crouch for extended period of time.
• Ability to read, understand and communicate to others written/verbal instructions.
• Ability to work and communicate with internal and external customers to meet the needs in a polite, courteous and cooperative manner. Committed to quality service.
• Ability to effectively supervise others. Follows and communicates policy and procedures and fully cooperates with supervisors of all departments.
Necessary Special Requirements

A current Colorado Driver License is required and must be maintained during employment. Must have a clean driving record with no DUI/DWAI convictions within the past five years. (A copy of your current motor vehicle record (MVR) will be required as a condition of hire). Must be willing to work different shifts (day and/or night), including weekends and holidays. Must be able to exert up to 50 pounds of force to complete essential functions of the job (i.e. lifting trash, pushing cleaning equipment, moving furniture).
APPEAL RIGHTS:

If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.

Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.

Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at spb.colorado.gov.

A standard appeal form is available at: spb.colorado.gov. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.

",State of Colorado Job Opportunities

Blue Canyon Technologies is a leading provider of turnkey small satellite solutions, including nanosatellites, microsatellites, and ESPA-class. We specialize in precision pointing platforms based upon our high-performance attitude determination and control components. BCT’s highly experienced staff has developed low cost, flight-proven, high-performance, high-reliability spacecraft systems and components that enable a wide range of missions for academic, commercial, and government applications. Our state-of-the-art spacecraft and subsystems are supporting LEO, GEO, Lunar, and interplanetary missions.
Blue Canyon Technologies is looking for an Accountant I with Accounts Payable/Receivable experience to join our team.
Key Duties &amp
column2: Responsibilities

column1: <ul>
• Enter, process, and reconcile invoices received.

• Monitor company credit card transactions to include receipt and statement reconciliation / filing

• Prepare customer invoices and monitor aging
• Process and pay invoices, and record credit card purchases
• Maintain vendor records
• Record and deliver deposits
• Prepare invoices and payment activity reports and send statements to customers.

• Answer accounting and financial questions through researching and interpreting data

• Experience working in AP and AR
• Thorough knowledge of accounting basics with general ledger experience
• Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
• Must be detail oriented and have good organizational skills
• Must possess excellent interpersonal, analytical, decision making, and problem solving skills
• Desire to work for a fast-paced, growing business and develop business structure and systems
• Possess a driven and self-sufficient attitude and great interpersonal skills
Working conditions:

This job operates in a professional office environment, but in a manufacturing company. This role uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, scanners, filling cabinets and fax machines.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Are you a salesperson who understands that providing great customer service and support will lead to increased sales? Do you enjoy working with a quickly expanding product and existing customer base (warm leads) while learning new and different things everyday? Do you thrive in an atmosphere where you work alongside some of the best co-workers in a collaborative, team environment? If this sounds like fun, read on to see if this opportunity is a fit for you!

Established and in business since 2005 and driven by our Core Values, The CE Shop is growing, our product lines are expanding, and our fast-paced ever-changing environment keeps you inspired, engaged, and on the move. We have been recognized as a Colorado Company to Watch, one of the Top 250 Private Companies, as well as one of the Best Places to Work. If this atmosphere sounds like a great fit, read more about this opportunity!
CE Shop ISR's make 100% outbound calls, with absolutely no cold-calling. Pay is an hourly base rate PLUS uncapped commission. The average total compensation is $50k.
Position Summary:

The Inside Sales Representative (ISR) is primarily responsible for closing sales opportunities through proactive sales efforts. The ISR will establish a rapport with the customer and demonstrate confidence to effectively sell our product, grow our customer base and support company initiatives. This will be accomplished by having excellent, in-depth knowledge of company products and state regulations with a focus on providing the highest level of customer service.

• Understand current customer needs and encourage customers to purchase additional products, with strong objection/response handling.
• Report system problems or process fixes and customer feedback to Customer Sales and Service Manager for long-term resolution.

<li>Excellent customer relations skills- written, verbal and active listening

• High School Diploma / GED. Two-year Associate's Degree preferred

• Ability to maintain all quote documentation with accurate pricing and configurations
• Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results on a daily/weekly/monthly basis.

• Ability to use analysis to arrive at logical conclusions and decisions.
• Someone with an ownership mindset, self-directed and self-motivating.

• Ability to problem solve and work on several projects simultaneously while continuing to provide quality work.
<li>Exemplary organizational and interpersonal skills.

• Ability to listen to and influence others.
<li>Ability to thrive on change as products evolve.

Technical Skills Required:

This position does not supervise the work of others.

4077b81d344f308f,2020-08-01 15:31:00 UTC,"Fresno, CA 93711 (Bullard area)",Account+Management,Fresno,2020-08-03 02:01:00 UTC,"Environmental Services - Renewables Energy Lead, Western US","

Grounded in safety, quality, and ethics, our experts lead their fields and guide our work with rigor, a creative spirit, and vision for growth. We draw from more than 20 technical specialties around the globe and are committed to fostering an inclusive community of diverse talents, backgrounds, and expertise. We’re a place to apply your passion and collaborate with top environmental talents on work that’s critical to our clients and the communities they support. Join a team that has the environment down to a science.
Your Opportunity

We pride ourselves on being recognized for providing some of the best environmental services to the North American renewable energy industry. With decades of experience, Stantec offers a wealth of technical knowledge and a strong understanding of federal, state and local regulations. From planning and siting to operation and maintenance, Stantec’ offers a one-stop show to bring renewable projects from concept to completion.

Our Environmental Services team is searching for a superior candidate with over 10 years of environmental regulatory experience within the wind, solar and hydropower sector to lead the expansion of our practice in the Western US. Joining Stantec’s North American network of over 1,400 environmental services professionals, with over 25 years providing environmental services to renewable energy clients, in over 100 office locations in the US, you will be given the opportunity to grow your career by leading environmental services for renewable power and infrastructure projects, winning work while working collaboratively to support business operations and project delivery. Does working with clients on great projects, with a talented team of professional’s while driving top line appeal to you? Apply today!
Your Key Responsibilities
Strategy and Business Development
• Identify business development opportunities consistent with the vision of the renewables sector in Western US.
• In support of the Renewables Sector Leader, drive the development of business development sector plans and account plans for the US West region, as appropriate.
• Develop and implement “win” strategies, including client contact, proposal preparation, and preparation of and participation in client interviews.
• Assist in providing input to and implement the annual business plan and budget for the business line.

• Understand market drivers and changes and develop innovative solutions to address these changes to increase Stantec’s revenue and market share within the environmental services renewables sector in Western US.

• Work directly with the National ES Power Sector Leader, National ES Renewables Sector Leader and other leaders, to help meet net revenue, gross margin, and operating income targets for the practice.
• Create and maintain relationships across Stantec’s practices and geographies to promote cross-selling of services.
Technical Consulting
• Personally, pursue and lead Environmental Services hydropower and renewable projects.
• Provide exceptional technical service to our clients.
Leadership
• Help develop a team of high performers through coaching and mentoring the region’s principals and client account managers to drive business development.
• Drive Stantec’s Safer Together culture, prioritizing the health and safety of our employees.
• Demonstrate a commitment to our code of business conduct and ethics policies.
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Established working relationships with renewable energy clients in the Western US.
• Ability to manage projects and business development activities simultaneously, working under pressure to meet deadlines.
• An entrepreneurial orientation with strong understanding of the business development challenges of a consulting services provider.
• A leader and coach who can apply their skills to complex problems.
• WORKING CONDITIONS
• Ability to travel that will fluctuate with pursuit and business demands.
• Time allocation to include a blend of direct time on projects (approx. 40%) and client and proposal specific marketing and business development.

• Key performance indicators include meeting annual sales goals, serving as a Client Account Manager (CAM) for one major account and achieving planned business growth goals (as established in the business plans)
• Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience
A bachelor’s degree in environmental planning, environmental science, engineering, or a related field. A master’s degree is preferred.
A minimum of 15 years of progressively responsible and applicable experience with program management and environmental documentation for renewable power projects.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Position Summary:

The Vending Warehouse Associate is responsible for warehouse clerical duties such as shipping, receiving, and packing orders. Also responsible for delivering orders to our customer that utilize our vending machine program. The Vending Warehouse Associate will deliver excellent customer service to our vending clients by stocking safety products (ex. safety glasses, gloves, ear plugs) to pre-set levels in the machines. Getting these orders ready for delivery includes preparing product for shipment and loading the truck. Pulling all vending route orders daily and planning local deliveries.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

  • This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday,
  • Overtime may be required due to required travel time to make local deliveries, as well as covering warehouse shift hours.

Work Environment

  • This job operates in a warehouse environment. This role routinely uses standard warehouse equipment such as forklifts, rolling ladders, and other material handling tools. This job is also required to operate vehicles, including box trucks. Use of office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
Physical Demands

  • Ability to bend, stoop, lift up to 65 lbs., climb ladders, and work on material handling equipment such as forklifts and other moving apparatus.
  • Work in an uncontrolled temperature environment and in a controlled temperature environment.
  • The position requires that an individual is able to obtain a medical certification according to DOT regulations and must maintain the certification in order to perform the essential duties of this position.

Travel

  • Local daily travel is a requirement of this position.

Required Education and Experience:

  • Minimum High School degree or GED equivalent.
  • Minimum 1-year experience operating a box truck or similar delivery vehicle.

Must have a valid driver’s license and able to operate large vehicles

Summary

Assists the Restaurant Manager in profitably operating the restaurant within the practice and procedures by Ghai Management. This position is responsible for cost control, customer service, restaurant and employee appearance, building sales, maximizing profits and employee development.
